Reviews.Title: “A relaxing and fascinating experience”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights at the Ruzzini. Beautiful location in the Campo di Santa Maria Formosa and midway between the Piazza and the Rialto bridge, it proved to be a splendid base from which to explore Venice. The room was spacious, well equipped and comfortable, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our breakfast and at times regretted that the hotel did not have a restaurant. We would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Beautiful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Christian T
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay of three nights at the Ruzzini Palace Hotel starting on the 1st of April. This was booked through an agent and we had the Deluxe Room. We took the Aleleguna water bus from the airport and alighted at the San Zaccaria stop which was about a 5 minute walk away (another option is the Rialto stop). It is possible to take a water taxi but this costs over 100 euro. When we arrived we were greeted with a smile and taken to our rooms, with the porter bringing up our luggage shortly afterwards. The deluxe room was on the top floor (there was a lift!) and was spacious and stylish, the old beams had been incorporated into the modern refurbishment of the hotel. The breakfast was a Buffett and was very nice, with a selection of cheeses, meats, egg, bacon, pastries, cereals and Prosecco! We asked for help at reception a couple of times and every time they were very helpful, friendly and professional. The location is ideal, only 5 minutes walk from St. Marks Square but far enough away to be slightly quieter and the view from our Deluxe room on the top floor was incredible. This was our Honeymoon so we splashed out a bit more but I think we would spend the extra money to stay here again based the amazing experience we had. Overall I'd have to stay this is probably the best experience of staying in a hotel I've had, and would strongly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Noceto
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel on the basis of TripAdvisor reviews and were very happy we did. The location was indeed perfect and the hotel itself pleasant, airy and elegant. Our room was spacious and overlooked the beautiful Campo Santa Maria Formosa, which is bustling during the day but quiet at night. Breakfast was served until quite late, which suited us very well as we managed to get to St Marks, the Rialto, etc. before the hordes arrived and back to the hotel in time for what amounted to 'brunch' (including prosecco!). The cafe in the square provided early morning coffee and pastries when we set off at the crack of dawn! The only drawback was the price. I know that EVERYTHING is extortionate in Venice but we found the â‚¬270 we paid steep and were only prepared to pay it because it was a special occasion. Some reviewers were obviously lucky enough to get a much better deal.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: BenJacqui
Reviews.Content: My partner and I did our homework on TripAdvisor and booked this hotel. We asked by e-mail for a room overlooking the square. They replied at once and confirmed our request. The room was spacious, comfortable and tastefully decorated. The staff were extremely helpful and very polite. Breakfast was perfectly good, given the small size of the hotel. It is also centrally located, with easy access to the main Venice attractions. We would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Jonnym_7
Reviews.Content: After extensive searching for a hotel in Venice I came across the Ruzzini Palace on tripadvisor that had great reviews, was well located and well priced. I managed to get a great rate that included breakfast for just under Â£100 a night. When I booked the hotel room, I contacted the hotel to request a high floored and quiet room, along with information on how to get to the hotel. The hotel responded quickly to emails and explained they would do there best to provide the type of room requested, and gave us a few options on how to get to the hotel. First option is for the hotel to arrange a private water taxi from airport to hotel, but this costs over â‚¬100, another option is to get a water taxi at the airport which is a littler cheaper, or which we did is get the Alilaguna water taxi. The pier at the airport is 5-10 minute pleasant stroll from the airport terminal. You can either buy Alilaguna tickets online before you go which works out at â‚¬1 cheaper or buy tickets at ticket desk at the pier. It's â‚¬25 each for a return ticket at the pier ticket desk. The best line to get is the orange line as this takes you to Rialto, which is a 5-10 minute walk to the hotel. Email the hotel for a map or print a google map before you go as there are a few twists and turns on the way, along with a few bridges with steps. On arrival at the hotel, check in was very quick and we were taken up to our room (in a tiny lift) which was on the top floor looking over the canal. Take into consideration they now charge â‚¬4 a day per person city tax charge, which at the time of booking was not aware of. We stayed in a standard room which was very large and very nice, with an excellent bathroom. It all seemed recently refurbished. So all in all, in regards to the rooms, no problems at all, was very pleased. Beds were very comfortable, but pillows not so much. I like flat, soft pillows, but they did not have these in the rooms, and when I rang reception they said the only types of pillow they have are in the room already, but all pillows In the room are the same, so I ended up stuffing 2 cushions in a pillow case and using them for the 3 nights. So, this part not really ideal for a 4 star luxury hotel, as most 4 star hotels have a pillow menu with at least 2/3 choices. The rooms have free wi-fi but you need to ring reception for a username and password to get online. Nice large tv but only 3 English channels which are all news channels, so glad I had my iPad which I could connect to Tv via HDMI to fill free time watching a film. Breakfast is served from 7.30am to 10.30am, so we went for breakfast on our 1st morning just after 10. At this time there were lots of empty tables that had not been tidied and remade for new guests so had to wait for a table to be prepared. At this time there were no croissants or hot food. The following day we had breakfast at around 9, which was a really busy time but managed to get a table which was made up for arriving guests. All in all a decent breakfast if you head down at an earlier time so you can get hot food, a decent spread of meats, breads, fruit etc. The best thing about this hotel along with the high standard of its rooms, is its location. Located in a quiet square, out of the way of the really touristy spots, but within a few minutes walk of the San Marco Square and Rialto bridge. Plenty of local restaurants that are all pretty much the same, except for price. Beware of high cover charges and service charge. Try and pick somewhere that does not charge cover or service. Avoid Da:Sabrina, it looks nice, but food is poor. In regards to the San Marco sites, you can get a pass for the Doges Palace and other San Marco museums for â‚¬16 which you can buy at the palace or online. You can also buy skip the queue tickets for the St Marks Basillica online for â‚¬1 each which gains instant entry at a specific time, as queues are always very long for entry, which is free. We also went up the Campanile which is â‚¬8. In regards to the hotel, all in all a super find in a well located, quiet area, a few minutes walk from everywhere. Rooms are large and very nice. Would definatly stay again if stayed in Venice again and would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Really made our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Tami P
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a place! I can not recomend this hotel enough. It is just a small hotel located close to the sights of Venice. We took a water bus from the station to Rialto bridge stopped and walked from there with our cases, Venice is a maze but the hotel gave great directions and despite wheeling two heavy cases we were there in less than ten minutes. The hotel overlooks a square and is only two minutes from St Marks Square which we could see from our window. We had a standard room and to our supprise the porter showed us the way to the top floor. Our room was quirky to say the least but fantastic! We had big wooden beams being in the roof, tea and coffee making facilities (The first time we saw this in Italy) and wooden steps leading to the window to look out over Venice and the square. The hotel had AC but also we had a velux which opened via a motorised panel on the wall. The bathroom was the best, HUGE bath with jacuzzi and powerful shower - that really was a fab supprise! The reception team were really helpful on providing advice on where to go and the breakfast was typical of italian buffets with cold meats, breads and cheeses but they also provided a bottle of ice cold Prosseco which is an added luxury. In all, best hotel I have stayed in, due to being small it was personal, the team remembered our names and wished us well and would definately return. Fully reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Hutchka
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at this gorgeous hotel. The location was perfect 5 minutes each way to the Rialto Bridge and San Marco. On arrival we were informed we had been upgraded which was a lovely touch and we had a Deluxe room on the top floor which had a beautiful bathroom and low beams. Breakfast was lovely so much choice and free flowing Prosecco. Every member of staff we came into contact with was so friendly and the reception were especially knowledgeable. Venice is expensive but the hotel bar had a great selection of drinks at reasonable prices, the wine was 4â‚¬ a glass and was not a tiny measure like in restaurants in town. If your going to Venice treat yourself and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Hols”
Reviews.Author: Paula F
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Ruzzini Palace after getting a public water taxi to the Rialto bridge, found the hotel fine with their directions and was greeted by the friendly staff also given an upgrade to our room because of our 25th wedding Anniversary.The room was lovely, only downside was the bed was hard and uncomfortable, found out after 3 days the frame was broke but our fault for not noticing sooner.The breakfast was very nice lots of choice. The hotel is very close walking distance to quite a few attractions, would recommend this hotel for a great trip to venice.Thanks to all the staff really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TanyaCoutts
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fantastic location, 5 minutes from St Marks and 5 minutes from Rialto Bridge. We had three nights here and could definately have stayed longer. Would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. Breakfast ample, price of wine for a night cap was cheaper than anywhere else in Venice, needless to say we had a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Trish and Larry Van Haaren - Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelcritic12357
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights.The hotel is spotlessly clean, beautifully decorated and excellently located in Santa Maria Formosa Square, about 5 minutes walk from both St Marks Square and Rialto Bridge. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. Our room (300) was a standard room, but it was beautifully furnished and had everything you could possibly wish for (except tea and coffee making facilities - you have to book a deluxe room to get this). The breakfasts were delicious - again everything you could possibly want to eat, fresh fruit, fresh fruit salad, cold meats, cheeses, yoghurts, bread, croissants, cakes, scrambled egg and bacon etc.. The multi lingual reception staff were always on hand offering advice of where to go and how to get there, also offering to make any arrangements. My husband travels all over the world and even he could not fault this hotel.There is a water taxi stop outside the door.l. As we had a late flight home, we were able to leave our luggage safely locked away. We have no hesiatiion in reommending this beautiful hotel and will stay there again next time we visit Venice. .

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: RichardDiB
Reviews.Content: if we were to go to Venice again I would make sure stay at the Ruzzini Palace..We stayed in a junior suite which was very spacious and clean. The staff was very knowledgeable and spoke pretty good english. This hotel is not in a touristy area but is within 10 minutes walk to all sights. We really liked its location as it was quiet and not swarming with tourists, mostly locals. Breakfast was top notch and they have well stocked mini bars. if possible take a private taxi to their doorstep from the hotel for a very steep 120 euro.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: pandarally
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 3-night stay at the Ruzzini Palace. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room excellent (clean and comfortable) and the breakfast very good (especially the croissants!) The hotel is only a few minutes' walk from the Rialto and St Mark's and the area is quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible start”
Reviews.Author: Deano23
Reviews.Content: Having read Tripadvisor i thought it would be a good hotel to stay at. We arrived at the hotel via a water taxi and basically hung our clothes up and then headed out to have a look round. when we came back we noticed the room (102) was really hot. I tried to lower the temp but the cooling system wasn't working. i phoned reception and they sent someone after a few minutes. Basically there was nothing they could do and said we would have to wait 'till morning before action could be done to address the problem because there was no other rooms although they did send some fans ! It definately seemed to be getting hotter and to be honest it felt as though i'd been out on the beach all day and had sun burn. My partner then went to reception and explained this was so uncomfortable. When she came back she was in tears and said the 2 men on reception had been really rude to her. Let's put it this way, after a frank discussion they found another room in the hotel, heaven knows why we went through all this upset in the 1st place when there was a vacant room all this time, ridiculous. Obviously the night's sleep wasn't the greatest after all that had gone on and i went to reception in the morning to complain once more about last night's problems. I spoke to a Gentleman called Simone who gave apologies and said can the hotel and us start afresh and try again. I have to say that Simone was very good and restored some of our confidence in the hotel and was even good enough to send a bottle of prosecco and some sweets to the room when we came back from the day out. To be fair this could have gone very very wrong after the 1st night, thankfully they had Simone there who had a bit of sense to sort the issue out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: AbiraJacobs
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an in-depth 8-day trip to Venice and stayed at the Ruzzini Palace. We loved the location, Campo Santa Maria Formosa -- close to St. Mark's, the Rialto, etc., but removed from the hustle and bustle. We had booked a standard room via AmEx travel, but kept remembering comments here that upgrades were worth it. So, we did an upgrade to a junior suite, unfortunately at our own expense, but negotiated down 50% from what they originally wanted to charge us. What a difference - the first space was oppressive and dark, the junior suite had 16" beamed ceilings and 3 windows. The building, a converted palazzo, is fabulous. The bed was super comfortable. The bathroom had ample hot water. The staff could not have been nicer. The included breakfast was great, and the in-house bar was quiet and pleasant. (Same space, different times of day!) Only complaint was that in the bathroom there was duct tape on the shower barrier and when I mentioned it at the desk they looked perplexed and we never got an explanation. We did our own laundry (travel laundry line, inflatable hangers) and didn't use any other services, so we were able to manage the budget well. One proviso - if you use the hotel's complementary water taxi to Murano, it will drop you off at a factory in the middle of nowhere (the factories pay for these rides) and you will be attacked by salesman/men. So find out the name of the factory ahead of time, get a good map of Murano, and immediately head over to the main drag. It's only a 5 minute walk but a world of difference. All in all, would recommend the Ruzzini Palace highly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Chloe1602
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me away for a suprise break and we stayed 3 nights in the Ruzzini Palace, on arrival we got upgraded which was lovely. The staff were very friendly and helpful and our room was really big and gorgeous. A downside was the aircon didnt seem to work and we couldn't open the windows as the people in the building opposite could see right into the room and vice versa! In the bathroom the shower was aimed at the window so unfortunately the poor cleaner probably had a job drying the curtains out everyday! Breakfast was great, plenty of variation and as it is served for 3 hours, plenty of spaces as well. On our second night we were woken up at 3am by a couple in the room next door, she was screaming and hammering on her door shouting --let me in! over and over. I heard someome ask her to be quiet and she responded by screaming at him. This went on for about 10 minutes. Obviously this is no fault of the staff by any means, however when I complained to reception in the morning they shrugged and said "no body died". Well no one may have died but I didn't get back to sleep!! Aside from that, a lovely hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Avenger V
Reviews.Content: I booked a night for a standard room with large advance for a romantic trip and with great disappointment I was given a room for disabled. With all the due respect for disabled people, you can imagine that the situation can be awkward on a romantic trip. The room has the door just next to the reception, so literally anybody look at you as you move in and out and stare into the room where there might be your partner in underwear. I have never seen anything like that in my entire life. The room is obviously sub-standard and shouldn't be used at all if not for people with handicap. Suggestion, avoid booking standard rooms in this place as you will pay crazy money for a substandard hotel, I had a 2 stars experience at most. As we settle in we soon realize it is freezing inside. I call reception and mention the issue, the answer is "yes I can see that, it is 17 degrees C in there as it was unoccupied before your arrival, we'll put the temperature up immediately". Shouldn't have they prepared the room for our arrival? I don't work in a hotel but it seems pretty basic common sense to me. We had to stay in the room with coats on and eventually had to live as temperature wasn't building up, the building is very old and very poorly insulated, especially if you are on the ground floor, in the corner of the building. The free WI-FI didn't work, not in the ground floor at least, and I tried with both PC and mobile. They charge local taxes even if your booking clearly include them. Buffet breakfast is full english but very poor. Fruit juices are not freshly squeezed and are horrible, a freshly squeezed orange juice is charged 5 Euro. Fried eggs 8 Euro, 10 with ham or bacon. Very poor representation of italian salami and cheese in terms of quality and selection (1 salami, 1 cooked ham and 1 cheese). During the breakfast the staff in the kitchen was clearly arguing and the whole atmosphere was pretty annoying. The room was poorly furnished and had very low ceilings, to the point that I wonder if they meet the health and safety regulations. Had to take the shower on my knees, it is supposed to be for people on wheelchair probably. You need to keep lights on as if you open the curtains you are in the middle of the square. This hotel has probably a lot of good reviews because of the people who chose a suite. For standard rooms go somewhere else or you might ruin your trip like it happened to me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: RestlessMac
Reviews.Content: We booked the Ruzzini Palace hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews, and we can say with all honesty that we were not disappointed. After all the endless searching and review reading, we were very pleased with our choice when we arrived at the hotel â€“ what a relief that was! The location was great; quiet, yet very central & near several nice restaurants and supermarket, etc. With a good map of Venice you will have no problems finding the hotel from Santa Lucia train station when you arrive. We got the vaporetto waterbus, line 2, and hopped off at the Rialto stop; from there it took about 10 minutes to walk. The room we stayed in was a great size, clean and bright. It was on the first level and overlooked campo Santa Maria Formosa, which was a bustling square of locals and their dogs â€“ great if you like people watching like me! The bathroom had all the amenities you would need and there is tea & coffee making facilities in the room. The breakfast was great, pretty much something for everyone, and the lady serving us each morning made a wonderful caffe latte. The staff were lovely, always helpful and accommodating with any questions. On checkout when I somehow (clumsily) managed to shut my finger in a door they showed genuine concern, which was appreciated. Please book with confidence. Itâ€™s a great hotel, with great staff, in a great location! I would definitely stay there again, and would recommend it to both family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: rachie1986
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need for a great stay in Venice! We were upgraded to a Junior Suite which was amazing! The staff were very friendly & helpful; they arranged a trip for us to Murano Island (highly recommended!) & were able to recommend restaurants etc. The breakfast was varied - something for everyone, really really good too! The hotel is clean, impressive and in a great location - 5 minutes walk to St. Mark's and 5 minutes to Rialto Bridge too. We love Venice & will stay here again when we visit.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT AND SOME”
Reviews.Author: Ali F
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked to stay at the Palace Bonvecchiati hotel, and when we arrived at the hotel (which was tricky to find as it is down a couple of side streets, we were not happy with the pompous and unfriendly reception staff. The room, (although as per the hotel photos) was adequate, but not lush or exceptional. Our view was a side canal and a wall of the building opposite. Anyway, we went for a walk, feeling peeved and let down (it was an expensive hotel). We were enjoying a drink outside a little bar near the Palace Ruzzini when we decided to ask if they had any rooms for the next 2 nights. I cannot tell you enough how friendly, and helpful the staff were. They not only told me about the different rooms, the took me to see them. So we took the bull by the horn, went back to the Bonvecchiati, and cancelled our next 2 nights there. Oh by the way it is 6uros an hour for wifi, or 22 euros for 24 hours at the Bonvecchiati. When I went to speak to the reception man at the Bonvecchiati I quoted room 106 instead of 160. He said, we do not have a room 106 and ignored me to serve another couple. (who I might add, had a baby in a pram with them, and they were quoted 35 euros a night for them to have a cot put in their room! Anyway, I can only praise the Hotel Ruzzini Palace Hotel. We went back and booked a de luxe double, (Which I had been shown and was impressed), however, we were upgraded for the same price to a suite. Wow oh wow, it was stunning. Overlooking the Square. With long tall windows with heavy velvet curtains to block the light at night. we also had a lovely long room, which had some chairs and a table, plus desk. Somewhere is sit and read, use the laptop (free wifi) or just have a cuppa. The bathroom was pure luxury, and the deepest bath I have ever used. Breakfast was delicious, and the choice of food was excellent. The staff were so helpful with directions, and gave us maps marking how to get to places we wanted to see. We really felt we were staying in an Italian Palace. We had two wonderful nights there, and after each day we retired to the chic, friendly bar in the Hotel. Another plus for us was that the Reception spoke and understood English very well. So if you are going to Venice, this hotel is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Mal V
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ruzzini Palace Hotel in September last year. The accommodation was superb. Upon arrival we were advised that our accommodation was upgraded. The suite was huge, with very, very high and ornate ceilings. We genuinely thought we were staying in a palace. The hotel was in an excellent location in Venice although a little challenging to find. The water taxi initially dropped us off about 150 metres from the hotel and we spent the next half hour trying to locate it. The breakfasts were modest and did not compare well with other hotels we had stayed at in Italy. The staff of the hotel were immensely hospitable and helpful. If I visited Venice again, Hotel Ruzzini would be on the itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good...”
Reviews.Author: CWTraveller99
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fantastic - a convenient walk to many famous landmarks and in a pretty square. The room that we stayed in was nicely decorated with good quality fixtures and fittings and was clean. The mattress in the room was extremely firm. The breakfast buffet was decent. Front desk staff were formal and helpful, and could speak good English. You have to hand over your room key each time you leave the hotel. There were a few things that could be better: - no kettle/tea making facilities in the room. - the room doors need soft closers, they slammed really loudly so we were woken up by other guests/staff on a couple of occasions. These two points meant that for me it was pretty good rather than very good.

Reviews.Title: “First class accomodation in great location”
Reviews.Author: lori61hall
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for 4 days Bed and Breakfast and were absolutely delighted with the location as only few minutes from the Rialto Bridge and the hotek was set in a picturesque square with fabulous restuarants close by. The attention at reception made us feel welcome at once and the staff on duty spoke many languages so not speaking a lot of Italian was not a problem. This is and old building which retains a lot of the old characteristics, with modern feel to the bar, reception and the bedrooms. Our room was on fourth floor ( with lift so no problem for those with mobility issues) and have wonderful old beams incorporated into the modern style of the room. The bed is the most comfortable i have ever slept in, in any hotel, and the sheets were spotless, crisp, white sheets changed every day, as were the towels.The bathroom was well appointed with tissues, cotton wool, shower caps, shampoo etc so no complaints there and had a fabulous shower, jacuzzi bath and oodles of hot water. Breakfast in the morning was superb, with yoghurts,fresh fruit, cold meat, cheese, juice,water, prosecco, croissants, scrambled eggs,bread, pastries and tea,coffee, hot chocolate etc in pots to your table. We will definitely come back here again when next in Venice!!!! Do not hesitate to come here it is one of the best i have ever stayed in for value, location and quality.

Reviews.Title: “The price demands slightly better”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I must say that we were largely satisfied with our stay at Ruzzini. I bought the weekend break as a treat for my wife's 40th birthday, and together with our 3 year old daughter, and we had a lovely time. The Good: - Beautiful palazzo. - Great location. - Very friendly staff. - Service was always correct & efficient. The champagne I pre-ordered was waiting in our room on our arrival. - Daughter made to feel very welcome. - Junior suite was visually stunning and was modern but with a real sense of history. The Less Good: - As many have said, the breakfast was a bit average. Everything was nice enough, but not very much selection, especially of hot food. - Bathroom was fine, but slightly on the small side. - No milk in room - had to be ordered in for us to make a cup of tea. - No iron in room (could have requested one, but decided not to bother). - â‚¬150 for airport transfer (which we didn't take). Whilst it sounds like a great service, that is an extortionate amount. You can get the water bus into town for â‚¬15 and it leaves you with a 10 min (pleasant) walk. The Worst - No free wifi. I knew this in advance, but I still think that today, any 4* in the world should provide this. - The bed was 2 singles pushed together and it was too hard. - Pillows were thin. 1 extra pillow was provided which isn't enough for a Junior Suite for 3 people. - Bell-boy was insistent (not aggressively) that he would show us to our room and then bring the bags up. I then waited for the inevitable, and incredibly annoying "linger" while he waited for his tip. When will hotels learn to pay their staff enough so that they can remove this culture whereby everyone expects extra payment for something the customer doesn't find particularly amazing. After all, I'm a big boy and after lugging my bags through the narrow streets and over the bridges of Venice, I think I can get them up a lift to my room. Getting them taken care of is nice, but ultimately disappointing when you spend the first 10 minutes of your stay wondering how much tip will be expected and how guilty you will be made to feel. OK - so my biggest gripes relate not to Ruzzini alone, but reflect some of my grievances about the hotel industry generally. We had a lovely time, and my wife had a memorable birthday. My advice to Ruzzini would be that your experience is very nearly GREAT. The niggles I have are pretty small, but they add up to be greater than the sum of their parts. Fixing the small things would stop people like me dwelling on whether this was a satisfactory 4* experience and just leaving with a satisfied glow.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: aussieontour42
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault the Ruzzini, from the moment we arrived we were treated with the very best service! Our room was fantastic, with two small balconies and a lot of space, this was by far the best hotel we stayed during our three weeks in italy. The hotel is very quiet at night but it is still close to everything you need. I enjoyed getting lost in the backstreets of Venice and the Ruzzini was always easy to find my way back to. Not too close to the Grand canal so it wasn't noisy, but close enough to walk everywhere. The Ruzzini is my hotel of choice for any future visits

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Warmth”
Reviews.Author: Skaramoosh
Reviews.Content: From the moment my wife and I arrived at the Ruzzini Palace we were put at ease with the friendliness and smiles from the staff at the establishment. The rooms were wonderful and the breakfast spread was simply great! The efficiency of the room cleaning is highly commended. The technicians of the breakfast spread are a delight. The front desk, Massimiliano, Francesco, Marco and whose names I have temporarily misplaced in my memory bank...Thank You for making our stay such a wonderful experience. The location of the hotel is a huge plus as it is central to the 2 main attractions, The Rialto and St. Mark's Square. Although it is conveniently located it does not feel at all like in a tourist zone. The square in front of the hotel gave us the sense of space which in Venice is a rare commodity. Within minutes to great food and shopping is at almost every corner. On our next visit to Venice, The Ruzzini Palace will be on our radar for sure. We highly recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: qnne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ruzzini for 3 nights just before Carnival. It was quite cold and damp season â€“ after sightseeing was so nice to return to warm room. Our room was tiny quirky dark room (called â€œclassic roomâ€�) under roof. Only light we got from bathroom (beautiful view to canal by the way...) The room was definitely overpriced - as everything at Venice. But we got 50% discount, so it was quite fair deal. We didnâ€™t got the palace feeling, because the breakfast room was served at small room of ground floor, the grand rooms were upstairs. I liked the location of the hotel even it was tricky to find at first (we took waterbus, not taxi). Breakfast was ok, service good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely restored palazzo in a nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Milo1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a family trip for New Year's, and we had a delightful time. The palazzo has been recently and sensitively restored, with intact architectural details in the rooms and common spaces. It's situated on a lovely campo with good restaurants and quality shopping nearby, in a nicely non-touristy, less-crowded part of Venice. Our room was comfortable and handsome, with very high, beamed ceilings, period-appropriate furnishings, nice bedding, and a deep and fabulous tub. We had an incredible view into the piazza and the room was bright and airy due to the tall French windows.The breakfast was tasty and filling,and the service was top-notch. The wi-fi in the rooms was another plus. I look forward to my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Clean + Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jamie T
Reviews.Content: They gave us a nice room facing the square. Liked the interior and the high ceilings. Clean and tidy. Breakfast was good too!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old word charm, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DebbieGT203
Reviews.Content: You should first know that this hotel is not on a large canal, so if you want to take public transportation to it, you will be paying dearly for a taxi. It is possible to travel by water bus then walk, but I'm glad we didn't, only because we were always getting lost in Venice (part of the fun of the experience) but would not have wanted to be towing luggage en route to the hotel. That said, it retains all the charm of an old world hotel with modern conveniences. It is somewhat removed from the hustle-bustle of the biggest tourist areas, so we enjoyed our quaint little campo where people just live, work and play. Small, quaint restaurants were in easy walking distance, as were some high end ones as well. Unless you stay on the grand canal, you will be walking and getting lost a lot. I found this charming and fun, but if that is not your thing, Venice won't be! Get a good local street map - most tourist ones do not suffice. Put on your walking shoes, grab the map, and you can walk nearly everywhere from this hotel, or to a nearby bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, great location”
Reviews.Author: markeygate
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel via private water taxi which was a treat (at 90 euros) but a great way to arrive! Once you arrive you are greeted by the very polite and helpful staff. We checked in very speedily and paid for a standard room. The room was finished to a very high standard and our room had two balconies overlooking the canal (excellent). The staff were first class and nothing was too much trouble. Help with finding a good resturant, etc. The breakfast was great and the rest of the hotel smart and well appointed. The hotel only has 29 rooms so has a real family feel to it. The location is superb. 5 minutes walk to St Marks and the rest of the City. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes style and a small hotel feel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise birthday”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room which was very pleasant, on the top floor with restricted views of the city. The room was quite warm and asked if the heating could be turned down and we opened the window. On returning, the room was like an oven, went to reception, they said they didn't know why as all heating was off. We persisted, as there was a fan belting out hot air. My wife looked at 2 other rooms on the ground floor but with no bath, just a shower. We were then given a junior suite. What a fantastic room. The receptionist said that it was booked for tomorrow, but you are here today, so we must make sure you are comfortable first. Had the room temperature been fine, we would still give the hotel 5 stars. The staff could not have been more pleasant. The location was fantastic, just 6 or 7 minutes from St Marks and the Rialto bridge. We will certainly be booking there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Canselmi
Reviews.Content: We took the water bus from the airport to the Rialto Stop and walked to the hotel. Had I looked up better directions it would not have been a bad walk, but it ended up taking us a little while to find it. Helpful hint: Navigating Venice can be quite a challenge. Make sure you have excellent directions/map. Our room was on the first floor (it was room #1 actually) and overlooked the square out front. The room itself was nice and spacious, but the square can get a little loud at night. Our fellow travelers were in room #2 which overlooked a canal, and they had trouble sleeping due to all the boats that passed through out the night. Overall, we thought it was a good room in a good location. The front desk gave us an excellent restaurant recommendation. The breakfast was pretty good. Free wireless internet was nice, but you had to get in just the right location to get a good signal. I wouldn't mind staying there again, if I were ever in Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ShootingStar100
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and thought the location was great, near to all the places to see. Breakfast was busy, so get the timing right. Our room was huge and very clean, we also got great measures in the bar as we were the only one's in! We stayed for 3 nights which and got a really great deal. The staff on the front desk recommended a restaurant, which we avoided at first as we thought we were being sold, but we were wrong - we went on our last night and it turned out to be amazing. Our water taxi picked us up from the hotel which was great. It felt quite special!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a very good lcation”
Reviews.Author: Paul Schofield
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our four night stay. Front desk staff were all friendly and helpful. Assistance with luggage was offered straight away. Initially we could not work the shower, but within 2 minutes of asking the desk, the porter was in the room showing us what to do. We were fortunate to be upgraded to a Junior Suite (I think booking direct may increase the chance of this). The room was great - spacious, everything worked - and there was a spendid view over the Campo. Campo Santa Maria Formosa is lovely. Venice can get very crowded, but the campo has enough space to wander around and it is just beautiful. One piece of advice - unless you are only carrying hand luggage or are very fit use either the hotels transfer service from Marco Polo airport, or just get in a water taxi at Marco Polo. Not cheap at 110 euros, but it delivers you right to the back door of the hotel. (The other plus is that the ride reminded me of a boat chase from a 1960s Bond film!). Once you have found your way around and can count how many small bridges you have to cross to get to Rialto, then its your choice as to whether you find a cheaper way back to the airport. We went for the water taxi again, left the hotel at 10am and were through Security at the airpot by 11am. The hotel is not cheap, but I would be more than happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “We would go back to Ruzzini Palace in a heartbeat, truly a gem.”
Reviews.Author: Ryyj
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff were excellent and always helpful , the room was large, clean and very comfortable. We were upgraded to the top floor with a wonderful view of the pretty campo . The hotel was just a short walk from all attractions and fine restaurants but still quiet and peaceful . The breakfast was excellent . Our transfer ( prearranged with the hotel) went smoothly. We would not hesitate to stay at the ruzzini palace again . ( we stayed for 3 nights ).

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Tam801
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, and we enjoyed an escorted transfer to the hotel. Our room was at the top with enough space for us. Twin bed room. Did spot one of the other rooms which was being cleaned and it looked beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great combination of old and new”
Reviews.Author: Peter K
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the back door by the water taxi arranged by the hotel, we were warmly received and given complimentary drinks at the bar. The very courteous and helpful staff provided outstanding suggestions and made reservations for restaurants. We enjoyed the quiet and relatively small size of the hotel. Our spacious junior suite was a well designed mix of the old and new. Breakfast was included and was excellent. As we had arrived after a stay in a large five star hotel in Paris, I was pleasantly surprised to find that I enjoyed the overall experience at the Ruzzini even more. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Half Term Break”
Reviews.Author: The-Big-Fishes
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel by Water Taxi from the airport (recommended but expensive). From the moment the four of us stepped off the boat and onto the Hotel landing stage, nothing was too much trouble. The staff were polite, friendly and very helpful with every request. The two deluxe rooms were well appointed with good views out over Venice and the nearby square. The Jacuzzi bath was entertaining even though the operation of it was confusing! The Hotel is approx 5 minutes walk to St Marks Square and is ideally located. Very quiet area (apart from the 'mass bells' at 7.00am, 6pm & 12.00pm!) The Breakfasts were very good, including a 'hot option'. The bar area was ideal if we wanted a quiet drink at the end of the day. The 'free taxi' to Murano was a definite bonus and made for a great start to visit the Island. All in all a hotel to seriously consider if visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great front of house”
Reviews.Author: StellaWestLondon
Reviews.Content: Venice is a complicated city which needs exploring in detail. We were helped in so many ways by the staff on the reception desk: finding restaurants that had been recommended, selecting the best ways to reach exhibitions, timings- all these fine details, which make a great difference to one's overall enjoyment, were answered with genuine courtesy. The hotel itself has been carefully restored and our room overlooking a small canal gave us a fascinating insight into Venetian navigation techniques. Breakfast was served until 10.30 which was a treat too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Leopards_cheetahs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a quite location and within easy walking distance of the main tourist attractions. The hotel has its own private landing stage, which is very convenient for arriving/departing by boat. Otherwise, you have to find your way around the streets from a boat station to the hotel, which is not so easy unless you know your way around. The concierge staff are very helpful. The rooms are a good size. Breakfast was plentiful. Although the hotel bar is advertised as being open until 11.15pm, in reality, it closed before 11pm and was unmanned after that time so not a good place to rely on a nightcap!

Reviews.Title: “Last three nights of a ten day trip.”
Reviews.Author: Houstan
Reviews.Content: The place is in a great part of Venice close to all the main attractions. The hotel has a direct water taxi dock (wish we would have know that before) because taking the ferry type boat is so confusing but costs alot less. I give it five stars except the room needed a paint job. The walls were all skuffed up for a pretty mondern hotel in an old building. The other downfall is you have to pay for wi-fi. I dosen't always work in the rooms but does downstairs or in common areas: 3 euros for 20 mins., 6 euros for 3 hrs., or 12 euros for 24 hrs.. This allows access to the lobby desktop with printer as well but make sure you logout after use on both wifi and desktop because it keeps track of only the amount of time you are auctally on so a three hour pass actually lasted us all three days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: janisc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at noon and they gave us an upgrade to a mini suite! We were thrilled it was a lovely quiet room overlooking the canal. We alos had the hotel arrange the transport from the airport to the hotel directly. It was expensive but it worked perfectly. We were greeted at the airport with a driver and he took us to a water taxi that took us directly to the hotel. It was a glorious experience going though the canals in a lovely private boat. The gentlemen at the front desk were extremly friendly and helpful and spoke perfect english.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable oasis amongst the canals”
Reviews.Author: tonysparents
Reviews.Content: This lovely old restored building was very comfortable. The staff were most helpful ,the rooms nicely equipped. The breakfast was average. By Venice standards the hotel is good value. It is easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Eli_Ashke
Reviews.Content: I have just finished a two night stay in the Ruzzini Palace hotel and was very pleasently surprised. Ruzzini was not our first, or even at the top 10, choice of hotels in Venice and I was quite worried that we will not get a fair value to the money I was willing to spend. Having made a decision to sleep in Venice itself, and not only that, but close to both San Marco square and the Realto bridge - the options for a good hotel at a fair price were not numerous. At the end the Ruzzini was selected and I can only say that it has met all of my visit expectations: Great location (less than 7 minutes walk from both San Marco and Realto) on a beautiful and quiet Campo, spacious and modern room and bathroom (we were given an upgrade), great breakfast (so unlike Italy's continental breakfast) at a charming location and, last but not least, very warm and helpful staff - all in all it made my stay in Venice much more pleasurable. Not only that, but there are some very good restaurants at a descent price located within 3 minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Accommodations and Service”
Reviews.Author: Hugh R
Reviews.Content: Having just completed a 14 day exhausting vacation, we checked into our prepaid destination in Venice for one extra night. Upon arrival, we were told that the hotel had overbooked and we were being placed at another location. Trusting in their professionalism, we boarded a water taxi (at their expense) and shortly thereafter arrived at the â€œRuzzini Palaceâ€�. And indeed that is exactly what it was-a Palace! It was constructed in the 9th century for the Doge, but with all the modern amenities that one could ever wish for in the 21st century. PERFECT location--within a ten minute walk to San Marco Square (which we could see from our window) and in the other direction--ten minutes to the Rialto Bridge. What a wonderful surprise we had upon arrival. We were greeted by the day the Concierge, Mr. Scarpa, with warmth and respect. The rooms were not quite ready so Mr. Scarpa invited us for a glass of wine in the lounge, until we could unpack for the night. We had previously made plans with friends to meet for supper and now they had no idea where we were---the concierge took care of all these details for us, made all the phone calls necessary and established a new meeting place. The evening was a success due to the attention of the professionals at the Ruzzini Palace. Every courtesy was extended to us to make our stay a perfect one. The hotel was quiet and very upscale, immaculate with every detail necessary being taken into consideration. Regretfully on the last day, in the last hours, we misplaced our video camera in the hotel. Saddened by this we left Venice early the next morning without it---- Within hours of getting home, we received an email from the Concierge stating that it had been found and they would be forwarding it directly to our home, compliments of the hotel. This was far beyond any service we have ever received in previous travels. We are both so grateful to the staff at the Ruzzini Palace for the warmth and personal attention that they give every respective client. We strongly recommend the Ruzzini Palace to any traveler wishing to have a positive and memorable experience. From, A grateful Canadian Traveller

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Terry187048
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary at the Ruzzini Palace recently and experienced a thoroughly enjoyable stay. We would heartily recommend the private water taxi from the airport - it provides a wonderful introduction to this remarkable city. On arrival at the hotel we were presented with a bottle of sparkling wine and throughout our stay the staff were very helpful indeed - professional, knowledgeable yet friendly. Also whilst we were there the hotel provided a complimentary private water taxi service to Murano that arrived and departed on request. The accommodation was excellent - spacious and well furnished. We routinely stay in 4/5 star hotels and this ranked alongside some of the best of them. The only minor criticism would be the rather limited choice of hot breakfast but please do not let that put you off - we really had a wonderful stay at the Ruzzini Palace and would recommend it to you without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: Matt944
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through our Tesco airmiles and we thought we were doing well when we arrived, then it just got better and better....... The staff were fabulously welcoming and we were upgraded to a fantastic suite. Architecturally, the Palace is stunning - a wonderfully historic building made comfortable by the modern changes. It is a refined place on a charming and fairly quiet square, slightly off the main routes but easy to get to and from all the top attractions of Venice - less than 10 minutes walk from St Mark's Square. The food is excellent. We will definitely try to return there soon.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jockp
Reviews.Content: This may not be the best hotel in Venice but it is in the best location to see everything,it is clean ,all the staff speak more than one language and could not be more helpfull, the food is excellent the rooms are spaciuos quiet with great facilities. We had a great week there.

Reviews.Title: “Venice and Ruzzini Palace = love at first sight”
Reviews.Author: sketteroo
Reviews.Content: Venice was my favorite city in my first trip to Italy and the Ruzzini Palace made it even more so. A beautful old structure made modern with renovations, our suite was very spacious and quiet with a big bathroom and plenty of storage space for all our luggage. The renovations are contemporary, a nice juxtaposition to the baroque-ness of the original structure. The location is in a quiet plaza away from the main tourist areas, but a short walk to San Marco. The front desk is manned by two extremely helpful, charming and handsome men who went the extra mile to assist us with restaurant recommendations and train reservations during a transportation strike. One note: unless you are traveling light, I highly recommend spending the extra euros on a private water taxi which brings you to the back door of the hotel. I plan to return to Venice next year, and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Some genuine SAFETY concerns”
Reviews.Author: ted d
Reviews.Content: We found the location, rooms, breakfast, and concierge service excellent overall, but with a few exceptions and issues which negatively impacted our stay at the hotel and our time in Venice. 1) The power was lost in the hotel several times during the day of our arrival. No reasonable explanation was given from the front desk whether this was a rare occurrence, whether the power loss was widespread or limited only to our hotel, or whether they had needed and brought in a repairman. After returning to our 6th floor room after breakfast, I cautioned my wife that we'd better take the stairs to the lobby. As luck would have it, the power went out again without warning, as we were heading to the lobby. Thank goodness we weren't stuck in the telephone booth sized elevator in need of rescue. Again, the front desk seemed relatively unconcerned for our safety, or of the power outage(s). 2) The next evening the smoke/fire alarms woke me up at 2:30 am. The hallway mounted (not in room) alarms were not very loud, and I needed to wake my wife and daughter, and open the room door to confirm that , yes, an alarm was sounding. The alarms remained on for more than 5 minutes, and we dressed and walked down 6 flights to the lobby. The night desk clerk seemed very flustered, and was desperately trying to turn off the alarms. He seemed poorly trained regarding the alarm and hotel's safety systems. He could not offer any information or explanation whether the alarms were for smoke or fire. I thought there may possibly be an electrical fire in light of the day's electrical and power outages. His recourse was to tell us he had called the day manager. We did see him propping open the lobby fire doors in an attempt to silence the lobby alarms( But, isn't that the point of auto closing fire doors?) Again, during this 30 minute interval he could not tell us the cause of the alarms, nor whether there was a a genuine emergency or false alarm. Interesting that only 6-8 guests eventually arrived in the lobby in the middle of the night, and evidently no attempt was made to have other guests evacuate their rooms. Was the alarm only sounding on the 6th floor hallways? Was it possible the hotel emergency alarm system would only evacuate a single floor? The day manager arrived, and also spent some time examining the alarm console and trying to reset the alarm. He brought up a ladder, and silenced the lobby alarms by pulling out the batteries or disconnecting the alarm wires. Again, not the way the system is likely designed to operate and function. The entire scenario made us feel that the hotel and staff are very ill-prepared, and poorly trained to respond to an actual life-threatening emergency. He, finally, explained that one of the guests was smoking in the room and set off the smoke detectors. We returned to our guest room after spending approximately 1 hour in the lobby with alarm sounds. No real apology was ever offered, and we asked whether the desk would instruct that guest that smoking was forbidden so that the alarms would not reoccur. We found it nearly impossible to fall back asleep. It made the following day in Venice most difficult and much less enjoyable as we had not slept the previous night. After writing the above complaint to the hotel manager, he apologized and offered a free night's stay the next time we're in Venice. I replied twice asking for compensation instead, and was told the hotel owner would need to make that decision. Evidently, the owner is either uninterested or remains indecisive

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: lippely
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything going for - stunning location close to Rialto & San Marco's yet off the tourist trail. We had a junior suite room 2001 and it was awesome - huge bed and totally silent. You never heard another guest or doors closing etc, all the things that can annoy you. Highest praise goes to the staff who were so friendly, helpful, gracious and charming. Their advice on restaurants is spot on. The (free) water taxi to Murano is an experience in itself. The breakfast was excellent, ranging from continental to cooked foods and sparkling wine. The hotel bar has probably the cheapest booze in town - any cocktail for 5 euros. I genuinely cannot think of any reason (large or small) for choosing any other hotel to stay in when visiting Venice. Did I mention that the hotel is beautiful ? By the way, do yourselves a favour - at the airport grab a water taxi for 110 euros which takes you straight to the hotel in 25 mins. I know it's a luxury but it is an awesome way to approach Venice and you feel so special arriving at the hotel this way. We'll shall definitely be going back. PS Our trip was 29th Aug - 2nd Sept 2011 - the weather was 30 degrees and I think the peak tourist season had just passed so even san marco's square was manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Family_Travelers2011
Reviews.Content: Me and my family went to Venice for holidays, and different from most holidays we have, we didn`t stay in a very famous worldwide hotel. We stayed in a local one. I imagined that the one we stayed in Rome was better since it had a worldwide network. I was wrong. Ruzzini Palace offered us an Upgrade because of my 7 year old sister, and also because my uncle joined us in the trip. Suite 101 in which is connected to 106 is fantastic! Highly recommended. Breakfast is great and delicious! WiFi is paid for a 24 hour service. You can log on and log off the internet, so you don't need to use it directly. One of the only hotels in Venice with a Piazza in front. Ruzzini offers you a transport from the Airport by car, and then into Venice in the Water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Service & Quality in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BHavesh H
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations in all respects - staff very helpful and friendly, breakfast thats worth the money alone and an impeccable room quality. When we arrived in Venice it was pretty late, the hotel upgraded us to their Junior Suite free of charge. The room was huge, high ceilings and all the extras you would expect in a quality hotel. Breakfast was one of its highlights - great start to the day, fruits, custard tarts, and cereals etc. The location is great as well - easy to walk to and from, walking distance to the pier and st Marks Bascilica, and lots of restuarants around it. Well worth the stay, I'd recommend it to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Peter P
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Great locations. Staff did everything possible to make the stay perfect. A few signs of aging etc apparent in bathrooms (the room fittings, not me...) but overall an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Definite and Worthwhile Splurge!”
Reviews.Author: WineDarkC
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family (including two teenagers) at the Ruzzini Palace in June. It was definitely beyond what we would normally pay for a hotel, however the photos and their website looked so appealing we figured we would splurge for a three-night stay. After all, itâ€™s Venice, right? My husband and I are both architects and we wanted to stay in a place that told up something about the city, and gave us a feel for the character of the place. The staff was charming when I made the reservation, stating in an email, â€œâ€¦We will do all our best to fall in love your children with Venice!!!!!â€�. We parked our car at the Tronchetto, took the people mover to the Piazzale Roma, and caught the vaporetto to the Ponte Rialto. After getting turned around once, we found our way to the hotel without too much trouble. The hotel sits back at the edge of the Piazza Santa Maria Formosa, a lovely, quieter piazza very conveniently located about a 5 minute walk from San Zaccaria, and maybe a 7 minute walk to San Marco. The lobby is elegant without being stuffy, and it actually has a gondola stop at the back of the space (unfortunately it is only available in the winter when the canals are higher). There is a gondola stop right on the piazza Santa Maria Formosa, for those who are interested (I recommend going in the morning, when the canals are quieter, the light is soft, and you can get a feel for the real life of the canals as neighborhood streets). As we were traveling with our children, we booked the Formosa Suite which consisted of two large rooms on the third floor with a long balcony fronting the Piazza (normally the childrenâ€™s room is a common lounge for the floor). The rooms were absolutely gorgeous! It was obvious that the Ruzzini family, having had three Dogeâ€™s in the family, had done well for itself and it showed in this ancestral home. The 12â€™ high, heavy-beamed, uplit ceilings provided the required gravitas, and the obviously old, original paintings made everything seem very luxe and special. There are other large drawings rooms in the building (one with a grand piano), that allow you to imagine them full of people during their heyday. Looking out over the piazza from our balcony felt very papal indeed, and the piazza was very low key. We enjoyed watching the local children kick a soccer ball around the square as much as we enjoyed watching the other people watching. The staff was excellent, snappy and professional. Breakfast, while not extensive, was very nice â€“ the prosecco is a nice touch - and certainly more than enough fuel to spend the next eight hours walking through the alleys and closes of the city. I would absolutely recommend the Palazzo Ruzzini again. It does not have the pretentious or anonymous feel of a snooty, high-priced hotel, but it provides a lovely stay in a building full of character, in one of the most magical cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms, Great Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: ColinGraves
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in one of the Junior Suites at the back of the hotel overlooking the canal. The room was great, well furnished, large, cool and quiet. The staff were always friendly. Breakfast biffet included was excellent with a wide selection including scrambled eggs and bacon. The location is great within easy walking distance of St Marks, the Rialto and the ferries. There are also plenty of restaurants nearby. Looking at the prices for other hotels in Venice although this is not low cost it is good value (for Venice!).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and well worth considering”
Reviews.Author: macGlasgow_UK
Reviews.Content: We had one of the rooms on the top floor which was rather quirky as the window overlooking the square is about 1 metre off the floor and in the room a small set of steps and a landing were constructed to enable occupants to look out over the square. We liked the unique shape and features of the room which had exposed timber beams and lovely dressed timber finishes. Room was large enough and bathroom was very good although despite advising reception that the jacuzzi was not working on several occasions it was never repaired. Staff very friendly and helpful and breakfast very good - especially if you like a splash of prosseco in your fruit salad. Would recommend hotel bar where surroundings are pleasant, where drinks are very reasonably priced and served very professionally with snacks on the side. Hotel offer a free trip to the glass factory which is great as the water taxi picks you up at the hotel and although the Murano trip is interesting be prepared for a number of sales pitches after the glass blowing demo. Hotel very comfortable and clean with good room service, wi-fi not available throughout hotel - it is an old building, and wi- fi reception available for us in the second floor common area which in itself is well worth a visit as decor is stunning with great views over the front square. Great location for visiting venice which did not prevent us from getting lost a number of times and also very close to a local supermarket for snacks etc. Would certainly recommend this hotel for visiting venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CalTravler55
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Huge rooms (we had two rooms - a junior suite and were upgrade for free from s standard room). One room had a wonderful view of the canal and the other a great view of the plaza. Hotel is a refurbished palace â€“ you can still see the original beams in our rooms. Really amazing place to stay. Good location â€“ close to Rialto and San Marco. Highly recommend. Concierge was very helpful and spoke excellent English. We had to leave very early in the morning to catch our plane and they arranged the water taxi and also had breakfast food bags prepared for us so we had something to eat!! Had umbrellas at the door for rainy days. Mailed my post cards without charging for the stamps! Everything you could want. (We did the free shuttle to Murano â€“ which was fine, but you only see one shop/factory and you would get to see more if you just pay for the water bus and did it on your own.)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: WillN55
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a renovated palace and the rooms are spacious. Bathrooms are great. Breakfast is good, but be sure to ask for proper coffee as the standard jug is instant â€“ the only disappointment. Service is good, and the whole ambience of the place is grand. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Angeline13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in June. We had two rooms on the first floor. One room overlooked the canal and the other room overlooked the square. The room overlooking the canal was a little smaller but had a sitting room. Both rooms were clean and comfortable. We did experience some noise at night from the square our first night. Since the square is quite large it seems to be used as a place to play a little soccer. It was actually kind of nice to experience the locals having some of fun. There was quite a bit of noise from upstairs, people in the room above us moving furniture and moving about. If you are a light sleeper you might consider getting a room on the top floor. Our rooms opened out to a LARGE parlor with a piano and several chairs and sofas. Since our two rooms were the only ones in that section, it felt like we had it all to ourselves which was nice. The staff at the front desk were very helpful. They assisted us with dinner suggestions, a trip to Murano and answered all of our general questions. The breakfast was included and was adequate. The location of the hotel suited us. We arrived and departed via water taxi so we did not have to worry about finding the hotel. It is about a 5 minute walk to St. Mark's in one direction and the Rialto Bridge in another. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again if we are lucky enough to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Sadia31
Reviews.Content: Found the classic room we stayed in was a bit small for us and there was no full length mirror and little storage space in the room. Had a problem with the bath which seemed to be blocked and the water wasn't going down properly. Did ask to get this fixed but no one did fix this as it remained blocked for the rest of out stay. However the bedroom was clean and the hotel is convenient for location. Maybe if you are planning to stay here upgrade on the room. Found it quite expensive for what we got in comparison to other hotels. Would call it 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Venice? Book this hotel :-)”
Reviews.Author: theblues10
Reviews.Content: Stopped for 2 nights on August 2nd/3rd in a deluxe room (402) which was situated on the top floor giving a great view of the beautiful square. Loved hearing the gentle noise from below, with the windows open, and with the windows shut the noise was gone. Room was great with a seating area that allowed us to rest our weary legs before heading out again to get lost ( in a good way) for an evening meal. Very happy with the breakfast and the Prosecco available every morning, allowing us to enjoy a Buzz Fizz on our anniversary whilst enjoying the lovely chocolate croissants. The hotel is very beautiful but their main jewel is the staff who were polite, helpful, knowledgeable, professional and funny. Well done to all of them and maybe the management should offer them out to train the staff in some of the restaurants/bars we visited who seem to rush about rather than value the customer. Venice is beautiful and we really enjoyed the long walks especially away from the mad crowds which is another reason the hotel appealed. If we had stopped in one of the busy areas it would have spoiled the charm of the city. We really enjoyed our stay but found the restaurants very expensive, maybe we ate at the wrong places but after talking to others this seemed a common theme. My wife loved the wine but I enjoy a nice cold lager and had to pay double the price I would back home which was disappointing. The hotel bar was cheapest for drinks in the city ( that we found). Took a water taxi from airport to hotel which was fantastic (if very expensive 100 euro) and enjoyed a gondola ride at night, another 100 euro but had to be done. We caught the water bus back from Fondamente Nouve,15 euro each, back to airport which took 15 minutes to walk too and was reached without having to fight through any crowds but you do have to cross about 5 bridges if you are happy to do this. Make sure you have a good pocket size map and enjoy your stay. (Please feel free to ask any questions). Thanks Ruzzini Palace you made our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, convenient location close yet slightly secluded from the busy grand canal,professional and obliging staff wo”
Reviews.Author: Barberoni
Reviews.Content: Got here yesterday we took water taxi which is quickest route from airport and â‚¬110. All bags taken care of on arrival and upgraded to luxury room which was very nicely presented. Both porter and concierge were very helpful for whole stay. Lovely bar and good breakfast I would definitely recommend this hotel as on top of all that it was really close to Rialto bridge and ten minutes ish from st marks but still quiet in the evening. Also cheap water taxi tour of city and out to murano from here â‚¬60 for two return and no pressure to buy.

Reviews.Title: “A solid 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: nteam_newyork
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in room no. 301, a Junior Suite. The room was palazzo-pretty (as pictured on the hotel's web page), impeccably clean, spacious and had a lovely view of Campo S. M. Formosa. The bathroom was modern, but just as spacious and clean. The lovely bath products -- everything from shower gel to bath slippers to disposable toothbrushes -- were plentiful and restocked every day. The hotel staff is generally attentive and helpful, though they never got around to fixing our hand-held shower. We did not really care, however, because the fixed shower worked just fine. The continental breakfast was a traditional European buffet, prosecco and good cold cuts and pastry, but fake O.J. and powdered scrambled eggs. The espresso was great, easily the best we had in any Italian hotel, and the staff knew our coffee preferences by Day 2. Ruzzini definitely feels like a palazzo, especially if you take the stairs to your room and explore the parlors. The location is great, a 10 minute walk to Rialto or P. San Marco. We look forward to coming back to Ruzzini and we highly recommend it. A word of friendly advice: don't make the mistake that we made and take the vaporetto from the airport to Ruzzini. Though expensive, the private water taxi is well worth the splurge -- the vaporetto stop (Rialto) is too far, there are many stairs along the way and you will inevitably get lost a couple of times.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Joelstein
Reviews.Content: We arrived from our cruise ship to spend 4 nights in Venice. The hotel met all of our expectations and then some. Room 402 was large, clean and spacious. The bathroom was modern and roomy. Staff were very friendly and very helpful. In short, we would definitely return. One word of caution, if you arrive with any significant amount of luggage, have the hotel arrange a water taxi direct to their door. It's a little pricey but well worth the cost. Otherwise the regular water taxi will leave you at Piazza San Marco which is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel, if you can find it, but you will climb and descend the stairs of at least 2 bridges with all of your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: larocan
Reviews.Content: We returned from Venice yesterday. Our two night stay at the Ruzzini Palace Hotel was as fabulous as all the reviews state. Location, staff, breakfast, room were all 5 star. The Ruzzini must offer the cheapest coffee and cocktails in Venice. Beautifully served with nibbles and biscuits. We arrived from our cruise ship by water taxi ... better than a gondola trip.

Reviews.Title: “stay in suite 302”
Reviews.Author: olivblau
Reviews.Content: phantastic view on the piazza. gentle service. suite 302 has balcony, and a large living room. we stayed 3 people in the room, (father, 2 daughters) which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Sandradot
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy walking distance to all the sights (San Marco, Rialto) but has a local feel in the courtyard and not so touristy. A great breakfast with the staff being very friendly and gracious. Our room was superb, top floor, modern and very comfortable. We slept great every night and loved the over sized bathtub. It's on a canal so water taxi took us right to the hotel. The hotel arranged a Murano trip for us, with a nice water taxi, which was free. The Glass Gallery had lovely pieces which were very spendy and there is a bit of a hard sell but overall very enjoyable. The wifi cost euros, but that seems to be the standard in most of the nicer hotels. My fave hotel of the three big cities we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Would strongly recommend”
Reviews.Author: suedUttoxeter
Reviews.Content: This hotel, which was once a palace has recently been refurbished and transformed into a wonderful hotel. Much of the original art work is still on the walls and ceilings. It is in a fantastic location on one side of a suaqre, 5 minutes from the Rialto bridge and within easy walking distance of the waterfront. The hotel is very well appointed, very clean and comfortable. Many of the rooms have fantastic windows that overlook the square and even those at the back overlook a canal where you can watch gondolers pass by regularly. The hotel also has its own water taxi stop, from off the reception area, so although these are not cheap, this makes it very convenient to get about or return to the airport. All the staff are smart and efficient and speak excellent English. I travelled with my mum and hoped I had chosed somewhere of decent quality. I am normally particular about where i stay and await being shoed to my room with fear and trepidation. On arrival we were greeted by reception staff who were smart efficient and very courteous, they made us feel valued and welcome and I was soon ceratin I had made the right choice. The room was large and clean and had all the usual facilities mini bar etc. The beds were rather firm but certainly not worn out and saggy. The hotel has a small breakfast area and the freshness and quality of the food was excellent. The hotel has a small bar serving hot, cold and alcoholic drinks and a small selection of snacks. The atmosphere was one of peace and calm, a haven after a hard days sight seeing. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone however particular and would return there without any question should I visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mfest19
Reviews.Content: This is a good clean hotel with a comfortable bed, nice bathroom and helpful waitstaff. The hotel has both an entrance from the street and water (good if You have a lot of luggage from the airport or train) The best part, however, is the location. The hotel is a five minute walk to saint marks square and the Rialto bridge, so you can hit all the sights and still have easy access to your room. I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT - LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: 60Chicks
Reviews.Content: this hotel is only 3 yrs old but the palace is centuries - the staff was great - the room was neat - putting the room key in a socket to keep the lights on was cool!! We had a side room with table/chair and kettle - nice new bathroom. Great location to get to anything by walking. 'They even arranged a private water taxi tour of grand canel and lagoon that was neat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: helenandneale
Reviews.Content: Venice is the most beautiful city and this hotel is perfectly placed in a characterful square near to all the main attractions. It's a lovely hotel in all respects and we would happily recommend it. Not cheap though - so maybe for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - would stay again in a heartbeat!!”
Reviews.Author: MMSNJ08887
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice - 5 minute walk to St Marks Square and Ponte di Rialto. Hotel is gorgeous, great location, breakfast selection was great (chocolate croissants were so good!), and the front desk staff was literally the best I have ever had at a hotel and I travel a few times a year. They were very nice, extremely helpful and their restaurant recommendations were great. We have no idea how it happened but we scored an upgrade and got to stay in the Royal Suite and a Junior Suite overlooking the Campo Santa Maria Formosa. The Royal Suite has a sitting room larger than my condo and a huge bedroom! This was the last leg of our trip in Italy so the upgrade was the icing on the cake and we had an amazing time! Thanks Ruzzini Palace - hope to see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Ruzzini Palace was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: JDV1927
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Ruzzini Palace expecting to have a standard hotel room. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite. And what a suite it was! It was large, even by American standards. Our windows overlooked Piazza del Campo, and when we opened them we could hear the church bells from the duomo across the piazza. The hotel staff was knowledgeable, friendly and always eager to help. The location was great because we were away from the Grand Canal yet only a ten minute walk to Piazza San Marco. It was one of our favorite hotels in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A real treat”
Reviews.Author: Debs&Mark
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a perfect break in Venice. We chose the Ruzzini Palace hotel based on other reviews, so feel we should give our update.
