My husband decided he wanted some space on this holiday, so booked a junior suite in advance. As heâ€™d pushed the boat out on the room, I wanted to push out the boat literally on the transport. We arrived by water taxi from the airport. 110 Euros â€“ booked at the desk near arrivals. It was a v fast and thrilling journey (15 mins) â€“ felt like I was in a James Bond movie! Although, admittedly, I was v relieved when the boat entered the quiet canals and slowed down. It was very exciting getting off the boat and stepping into reception. We were taken straight to our room which was lovely and cool. I have never slept in a room so tall â€“ at least 4m in height. Felt very grand. The strange thing was the floor, which sloped. The effects of age and sinking? DÃ©cor was beautiful, but Iâ€™m not sure about the fusion of the old room and the new bathroom â€˜podâ€™. We were a bit disappointed to discover that there was no food available in a 4star hotel between breakfast and 4pm. All we wanted was a quick sandwich, but the bar only did snacks from the afternoon and room service wasnâ€™t available until the bar started serving the snacks. Not to worry, the reception desk gave us directions to a nearby cafÃ© serving snacks and pizzas. We spent the first afternoon/evening on foot in order to get our bearings. The hotel really is only 5-10 mins walk to St Marcos or the Rialto, depending on how many photos you take along the way! From there, itâ€™s really easy to pick up a vaporetta. We bought a 36hr pass and used them extensively â€“ for trips to and from places and to journey up and down the Grand Canal. At first, the hotel staff kept trying to get us to go on a personal boat tour and a glass factory tour, but after a couple of refusals they stopped. They offered to organise a gondola from the hotel, but it seemed very expensive. We took one from Rialto, but that seemed pretty short too. The best bits were the side canals, so it would be worth looking into a pick up from the hotel â€“ or checking out the gondolas near the bar/church. We didnâ€™t compare prices/routes, which in hindsight we should have. It was a unique and priceless experience anyway. Breakfast in the hotel was good, but nothing exceptional. Waiters were a little overworked so you had wait patiently for refills of any food that had run out, or to get a table one morning. For me, the styling of the hotel and its location were the biggest advantages. Reception were v helpful in booking us tables in restaurants and organising a water taxi back to the airport. Unfortunately no-one on our flight to share the cost, but the hassle and time saved was worth the 100 Euro door-to-door cost. The only blot on an otherwise perfect stay was the fire alarm going off at 2:30am on our last night. A false alarm, but it went on for ages and stopped me getting my final night of perfect sleep in the big bed with beautiful linen. The Ruzzini was a real treat. If you can afford it, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “certainly not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: molaw_11
Reviews.Content: After reading the exceptional reviews we were very disappointed in this hotel. We stayed for 10 days and feel that we had time to make a better judgement than the previous reviewers who had stayed for a matter of a few days. On arrival our reception was not as welcoming as we had been led to believe. The receptionist was only interested in selling us tours and lost interest when we told him this was not our first visit to Venice. We had an upgrade to a room overlooking the square which was adequate but hardly up to the glowing reviews and certainly not 5 star. rather gloomy and a very hard bed. The cleaners did a wonderful job and could not be faulted. The breakfast was no more than adequate, same thing every day without any variation. The orange juice was awful, watered out of existence. You had to buy squeezed orange juice from the bar. tea making faciities did not include coffee. We had to buy instant coffee and fresh milk. the milk they supplied (on request) was UHT.) The waiters were a little friendly and the cleaners also. 2 receptionists (Mario and the young man with the red hair and beard) were the only ones who were helpful and friendly. The tall guy with the glasses on was downright miserable. The hotel is very interesting but generally does not warrent all these rapturous reviews. I can only think that they have not experienced 4 or 5 star hotels. Venice itself is not the Venice that we knew 7 years ago. I know it is in a state of being restored and that can not be avoided, it badly needs it, but the masses of people arriving on the cruise liners is apalling. Everwhere is crowded from dawn to early hours of the morning. I'm afraid we wont be going back to Venice. It is so expensive, can you believe 1 euro 50 cents to use a loo. It's back to the Mediterranean for us. Venice has lost it's way and it's romance in it's rip-off quest for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Very Good Service - - Would Definitely Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Embargado
Reviews.Content: My family and I took two rooms at this hotel in June 2011. Very nice hotel with very good service. Excellent and diverse breakfast buffet - - better than all of the other hotels we stayed at during this trip. Friendly and knowledgable staff, well located. Rooms are nice, well decorated and relatively spacious. Rooms are decorated in a very contemporary style - - different from the Victorian era styling that you find in other similar hotels. The hotel bar was the most reasonably priced of all the hotels we stayed at on this trip. The only complaint would be the rock-hard beds - - definitely the hardest of the four hotels that we stayed at during this trip. Ended up using the bedspreads to add padding under the sheets

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: TheGirls86
Reviews.Content: We found everything about this stay, better than expected. Staff friendly & helpful, accommodation excellent (we were up graded FOC), location easy access to St Marks Sq etc (once we had worked out the best route), and breakfast - spolit for choice. Ruzzini Palace is located in a quiet area but still has alot of local astmosphere. We would not hesitate to recommend it and hope we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: ChuckGlobal99
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Ruzzini Palace in a jr. suite as part of our honeymoon trip in Europe. The location of the hotel is very good, the staff were friendly and gave good recommendations for activities and restaurants. We really liked the room and the view from the room and I would have rated it excellent except the kingsize bed is made by pushing 2 beds together and it made it a bit uncomfortable, seems like a small point but this is a beautiful room in an expensive hotel, why skimp on the bed? Anyway we still enjoyed the stay and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “We never wanted to leave”
Reviews.Author: azresptech
Reviews.Content: The location is a short walk from St. Marks Square, but away from the hustle and bustle. Our room was clean and very comfortable. Each room was unique in this restored former palace. The water taxi delivered us directly to the steps of the hotel. All of the staff we meet were friendly and efficient. The breakfast buffet was delicious, but we did not eat dinner at the restaurant. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family, and would stay here again if we return to Venice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: wychwoodbabe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ruzzini Palace for 3 days to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. This was our second booking at the Ruzzini Palace. We have definitely found our perfect hotel. The setting is superb, the rooms excellent and the service first class. The breakfasts are a delight â€“ to include chilled Prosecco! All the staff made our stay memorable for us, however, Francesco, the senior concierge, went the â€˜extra mileâ€™ for us; he was wonderful in helping my husband, organise the most special of surprises that helped to make our weekend the memory of a lifetime. I cannot praise this hotel and its entire staff enough; we cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristineHaddington
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel. The staff were very helpful and could not do enough for us. The hotel was very close to all the main attractions 10 minutes walk from ST Marks. There are plenty of resturants in the area. We stayed for 4 nights and it was always a pleasure to return to the hotel and unwind in the bar. The cocktail menu was excellent. This was a trip of a lifetime and everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Russell's vacation - Stop 1”
Reviews.Author: The_Russells_trip
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy and our first stop. We pre-paid for the transport from the airport. I highly recommend this especially if it's your first time. HOTEL: (2 nights) Very nice, room was beautiful with marble floors. Separate sitting room. (I'll post pics) View wasn't great but we didn't spend much time in the room. You get the best view when touring the city. Staff is very formal and a bit stiff, but they helped us whenever we asked. The hotel is in a nice area and was accessible by water taxi. It is a bit far from St Mark's Square though. All of our tours met and left from St Mark's. Fortunately we walked there the night before, so we'd know where to go. It is also a long walk to the Rialto bridge. There is a bank/ATM in the square right outside the hotel. They also have a flea market in the square. I think it's every weekend. Breakfast was good (for Italy). I missed my hot American breakfast though. BTW the red juice is blood orange juice. I was surprised at how many people have never heard of a blood orange. I would recommend this hotel. Although if we get to go again, we'll probably stay somewhere a little closer to St Mark's. Next stop Bologna and 4 Viale Masini Hotel Design. VENICE: is beautiful and very expensive- gondola ride at night 100E; water taxi to train 70E -- 12 oz Guiness and 1 white wine 32.50E (>$40) but having a drink in St Mark's Sq-priceless ;) Venice is not wheelchair, stroller, etc friendly. Many steps and broken uneven ground. I highly recommend the Murano, Burano & Torcello tour. Also the walking tour of Venice, and definitely see the Duomo. ITALY: Try to speak Italian as good and as much as you can. Donâ€™t use any suspicious ATM and cover your hand when you enter your pin. Be very mindful of pick pockets. The names of the streets are etched on the corner of buildings ~10 feet off the ground. Bring a good camera. and one that can take good pics without a flash (Most indoor places allow picture taking without a flash). Definitely bring good walking shoes. The ground is stone or marble and very uneven unless you're in a church. Sandals and heels are not good. Bring a washcloth/puff. The hotels don't have them. Ladies, after a long touring day it's nice to take a shower before dinner, so bring lots of clean underwear :) We had the best travel agent and highly recommend her: ROUND TRIP TRAVELS Loretta Lamberth ( -- )

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in an ideal location :)”
Reviews.Author: sweetcheeks3325
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our homeymoon and it was absolutely perfect!!! We were treated like royalty, the staff couldn't do enough for us. The room was large, clean and beautifully furnished. We had a fabulous view of venice from our balcony, and chilled champayne on our arrival. The cocktails at the bar were fantastic and the breakfast had so much variety. It was only a short walk to St Marcs square. You couldn't ask for a better location. You really can't go worng with this hotel its amazing !! :)

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: gooders47
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days Monday to Friday, the room was the standard in the "attic" and was absolutly fabulous, service excellent, staff wonderfull, breakfast till you burst and keeps you going to avoid the cities rip off prices, drinks in the hotel when you return in the evening are the best value in Venice. Take thier offer to collect you from the airport, expensive but good value compared to the struggle with public transport and the walk to the hotel! They offer good trips and lots of advice, everything is only a short walk from here. We will return as soon as we can and defy anyone to find anything wrong with the Ruzzini Palace Hotel. Many thanks to al for a special week. John and Anne

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: AntMo
Reviews.Content: A one night stay at the end of our MSC cruise provided us with an experience that we shall not forget. From arrival at the door by water taxi to our departure the following day, the staff could not have been more helpful or courtious. Our room was fabulous and the buffet breakfast very good. An ideal venue from which to explore the sights of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, beautiful hotel but watch out for the sales pitch...”
Reviews.Author: Kate1237
Reviews.Content: When we booked for one night in Venice, we were impressed with this hotel online. They were a pleasure to deal with via email ahead of our visit and I wanted a five star experience so I didn't mind the substantial cost of the hotel. The location was wonderful, not too close or too far from the crowds and sites. If you do not have a lot of luggage, take the water bus. It was really very easy to get to the hotel from the stop at the Rialto Bridge. The room was beautiful, although the beds and cold floors were not too comfortable and the bathroom amenities were less than I saw in other hotels in Italy. The view from the junior suite balcony was stunning. What was disappointing was service. Every time we went to the front desk we got a sales pitch for a boat ride around Venice and to Murano. Every...single...time. One of the reasons I book an expensive hotel is to take advantage of concierge services. We were not able to get any reasonable help or answers to our questions. I was particularly frustrated when I asked about booking a gondola ride. I was told - why go on a gondola when you can take the offer to go in a taxi ride? Why take our family on a gondola ride in Venice? Because it's Venice! We ended up having to take our chances with a random gondola provider. If you book at this hotel be ready to book other services on your own, and be ready for the sales pitch. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 2012travelguide
Reviews.Content: What can you say !!!! When from the time you arrive until the time you leave the service is great. Arriving by water taxi magnificent and position for your exploring just t wonderful It is indeed a great hotel and makes a stay very enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Belissimo”
Reviews.Author: fromsurbiton
Reviews.Content: My sister and I visited for three nights and relied on the trip advisor reviews when choosing the hotel. We can only agree with everyone else's positive feedback. The hotel is in an excellent position, centrally located in a lovely peaceful square, which is a favourite spot with many locals, there are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. It was lovely to arrive at the hotel from the airport by water taxi which the concierge organised for us in advance - this also saved trundling cases through narrow busy streets and over bridges. The hotel is beautifully designed and our room was large and very stylish. The staff were extremely polite, friendly and efficient. The breakfast choice was excellent - we did not use the bar as it was so quiet but would recommend the small bar/cafe located in the square on the edge of the canal, a lovely spot to sit and enjoy a sprtiz or bellini whilst watching the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lindavisitor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautiful venetian palace with modern rooms in a well known square. Arriving via the canal entrance by water taxi is magical and worth the Euro 100 standard fare from the airport. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is good (except for the watery juices). Quite central to St Marc's & Rialto (all within 10 minute walk, if you don't get lost). Room amenities are ok, toiletries are ho hum,no bath robes but a jacuzzi bath in our room was a treat. Overall would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “6 star Service in 5 star premises located in 5 star setting - wny 4 stars?”
Reviews.Author: LT-Planetwanderer
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Ruzzini Palace for 2 nights and I think it is safe to say that we have found our place for Venice forever. Travelling a lot and staying in many hotels around the world, I have come to understand that only very few places make you feel completely at ease, almost as if you are at home. Ruzzini manages that, with the best of them - and then a bit more! Service is impeccable: friendly but always in a formal and courteous manner. I had a lot of requests before and during the stay and not once did they fail to answer - always quickly, efficiently and always finding a solution. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous - I would really recommend going the extra mile and booking a suite overlooking the Campo di Santa Maria Formosa. It is really worth it! The location of the hotel is also a bonus - once found the first time round (tip: just follow the hotel instructions and don't use a GPS finder designed for cars as I did :-) ), then it is really easy to find after that. Less than 10 Min walk to San Marco and Rialto Bridge, away from al the tourist bustle and hassle and set in a much more local/Italian setting of the Campo Santa Maria Formosa, where locals can be seen enjoying their coffee, kids playing and tourists as well as locals can see the meaning of " La vita e bella"! The only thing I do not get is why this place is a 4 star hotel relative to some of the 5 star hotels I have stayed/seen in Venice this time as well as in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: simon_bickerton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Ruzzini Palace for a 3 night break. Location is perfect - close to the centre of Venice, but away from the really touristy parts. Service was excellent - staff were helpful, polite and friendly. Lovely breakfast (plenty of choice) and fantastic cocktails in the evening (at a very reasonable price - for Venice!). Room was large enough, comfortable and very clean. Had all the facilities we expected. We will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but take the water taxi”
Reviews.Author: SpartanFan73
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel, it is an old palace that was converted into a hotel. The staff was very helpful, we were upgraded into a huge suite with a balcony overlooking the canal, and the location, equidistant between the Ponte di Rialto and Piazza St. Marco was perfect. Highly recommend it. Ignore the guide books at take a private water taxi from the airport to the hotel. It is worth the 100 Euros. We (as recommended) took the public Aliliguna water bus which dropped us off (as promised) a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Keep in mind that is 10 minutes if you know where you are going and over 4-5 bridges with many steps. If you don't mind shlepping luggage all over the place fine but my suggestion is pay the extra fare and get door to door service. It is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: giglens
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous stay at this lovely hotel. Junior suite 102 overlooking the square, as another reviewer said, is just amazing, worth the upgrade price, great design, a real character room that you will not forget. Always something to see in the piazza but not noisy. Very attentive staff, good breakfast, close to Rialto & S Marco - ten minutes walk once you find your way - and from there by vaporetto to everywhere. Also five minutes walk to the beautiful S Maria dei Miracoli. Maybe bettered by the Danieli - but at a price for such a room.Highly recommended - we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Pauline_E_H
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice, having stayed at the Ruzzini Palace. All I can do is reiterate what has already been said in previous reviews. It is fantastic, from the moment we arrived until our departure the staff were most helpful, and readily provided advice and suggestions of where to eat, where to visit etc. I cannot praise them enough. Our room (aJunior Suite) was beautiful, and everywhere is spotlessly clean. Do take the trip down the Grand Canal and to Murano which the Hotel will arrange for you - it is worth every penny, once at Murano you will be given the hard sell, but all you need to do is politely say "no thank you" ,unless that is you would like a â‚¬160000 chandelier! We will certainly return to Venice, and will definitely stay at the Ruzzini Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: caz1950
Reviews.Content: The Ruzzini Palace Hotel was a total delight. It is located halfway between the Rialto Bridge, and St Marks Square, both reached through a warren of alleys - you definitely need your map. We arrived by water taxi, straight into the reception area but one of the delights of this hotel is that on the other side of the reception area, the hotel opens out into a beautiful square. The square has some market stalls, a couple of cafes and families, children and dogs playing in the afternoon. Fairly unusual in the centre of Venice. I feel it is an area undiscovered by tourists. Our room was behind reception on the square side. It was very spacious and unbelievably, quiet at night. My brother and his wife were behind reception on the canal side and their room was very good as well, other than the bathroom where the ceiling over the shower was a bit low for my tall brother. Staff at the hotel were exceptional and nothing was a bother. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MateusR
Reviews.Content: Excellent Service, Excellent Room, Excellent Location, OK Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: LynkayLangdonHills
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in Junior Suite 102, exactly as shown on their website. Lovely room overlooking the square, huge bath. Great to sit having a glass of wine people watching at the end of a day sightseeing. Great location between the Rialto and St Mark's Square. The staff are wonderful, greeted us by name when we arrived. They had lots of suggestions for sightseeing and restaurants. The hotel provides a complimentary trip to Murano. The bar is great and when we asked for a bottle of Merlot (â‚¬14) to take to our room, a tray with beautiful balloon glasses and crisps appeared. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic Venician experience”
Reviews.Author: Raisey
Reviews.Content: Deserving of its 4 star rating. In a quiter area within 10 minutes if St Marcs Square and the Rialto. Fantastic rooms, we stayed in a Junior Suite. Excellent breakfast. Very helpful and knowledgeable staff. the hotel is beautifully decorated mixing the modern and old perfectly. Having walked around Venice we didn't see anywhere else we would have preferred to stay. We would highly recommed the Ruzzini Palace as the perfect place to stay whilst in Venice. Get a water taxi to the hotel, expensive but the perfect way to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sara W
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ruzzini Palace hotel from 18-21 March with my husband for our wedding anniversary. The most efficient (and less pricey) way to get from the airport is the Alilaguna boat service (orange/arancia line) which goes directly to the Rialto stop and is only an 8 min walk to the Ruzzini Palace. That said, be prepared to get lost when you first have to find your way; what should have been a short walk took us 45 minutes because we took a wrong turn, but this was all part of the experience... The hotel is lovely; a very nicely converted palace with a beautiful entrance area and a nice bar/breakfast area. We stayed in a spacious deluxe room on the 6th floor which gave us views over the Campo Santa Maria Formosa (so as a result, the church bells did keep us awake on occasion) but was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The buffet breakfast was excellent and the bar prices were very reasonable, considering the standard of hotel. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, and spoke impeccable English. Although St Mark's Square and the main sights are lovely, head out for a long walk without a map, and see the real Venice - we came across a number of beautiful squares filled with churches and cafes, which we wouldn't have seen otherwise. The Peggy Guggenheim collection is well worth a visit. Thoroughly enjoyed our trip and our stay at the Ruzzini, and will return here if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Zuban
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were booked into a classic room - this was on the ground floor next to the reception and wasn't really what we were expecting. We upgraded (at a charge) to a junior suite, which was much more like it. Four poster bed, tall ceilings, intricate artwork and great views out onto Campo Santa Maria Formosa. The location is very convenient, with just a 5 minute walk to either Rialto or San Marco. It was very easy to get to, and I'd almost advise getting off at Ft. Nove if you're catching the Alilaguna line from the airport, as the waterbus is quite slow and it takes 10 minutes to walk from there at most (minding out if you have lots of luggage however), rather than the 20 or so minutes it will take to get around to San Marco. The staff were very friendly, both front of house and in the bar / breakfast. Breakfast was good, the pastries were cooked fresh I believe and were delicious. All in all, a very good stay. My biggest advice would be to stay in one of the suites as that's when this hotel really does come into its own.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: lulujack
Reviews.Content: The Ruzzini Palace is absolutely superb. It has such a wonderful feel to it â€“ oldie worldie embracing modern comforts. The staff â€“ all of them â€“ were very professional, friendly and helpful; they really enhanced our stay - Venice is such a confusing place you need a helping hand and recommendations every so often. We had one of the classic rooms on the 6th floor â€“ or maybe it could be described as a budget room with views over roof tops â€“ thatâ€™s when you stand on a chair to see out of the window! But the room was totally fine, a simple double bed, nice bathroom â€“ clean and not too bad a size. For the money we paid â€“ have a look at Travel Republic for a fabulous deal â€“ we couldnâ€™t have asked for more. A four star hotel of this standard for under Â£80 a night â€“ hello? Other good points are the bar â€“ the drinks are ultra reasonable, Â£3 for a big glass of wine, good quality too. With trepidation we took up the hotelâ€™s offer of a free water taxi to visit one of Muranoâ€™s glass factory. We had a fear weâ€™d be shackled in the factory for six hours and wouldnâ€™t be allowed to leave till we had bought at least twenty chandeliers. But not at all, the glass blowing demonstration was fascinating, we nodded enthusiastically as we wandered the showroom and then said we wanted to leave. We were thanked for coming and shown out! No hard selling, just a casual wave goodbye. So if you want somewhere with total class, in a great location, I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to recommend this hotel. It surely must be one of the best out there.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing hotel in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Combe274
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. Centrally located itâ€™s easy to find, once you know how to find it! The first time itâ€™s trial and error down the alleyways from the Rialto Bridge. But thatâ€™s half the fun. Once there a warm, welcome awaits from the front desk staff who all speak English. The room was spotlessly clean and the bed huge. Everything worked and the safe in the room was very useful. The breakfast buffet was good quality with all the usual continental suspects, plus the addition of a fresh bottle of Prosecco for those who like to start the day with a bucks fizz! In the evening the boys on the bar are welcoming and smiley. The Merlot is fabulous. I booked this hotel on the strength of Trip advisor reviews and having been would recommend it without reservation to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Venice... A MUST!”
Reviews.Author: ZackWallick
Reviews.Content: The Ruzzini Palace will blow you away as you walk through the square up to the hotel. Once we arrived we were greeted by Francesco at the front desk who was very welcoming and such a nice person. Francesco surprisingly upgraded us to a suite which overlooked the entire square. I am not a frequent traveler but will take at least one trip a year, and this room that we stayed in has got to be by far the most elegant I have ever experienced. If you have ever seen the movie the "Tourist" with Angelina Jolie and Johnny Depp the room was similar to the room in the movie. No lie the room must have been 2,000 sq/ft +. It had a beautiful bathroom as well as the main bedroom area. There was also a door that led into a large loft to casually watch TV or entertain guest. The painting on the walls were a bit creepy to me but that may have been the wine getting to me. All in all I was very impressed with the service and the room as well as the rates. However the rates may vary because we visited in February which is low season. If you are interested in this hotel I would recommend booking way in advance especially during high season because there are only 11 rooms in the entire place. If this is your first time in Venice be sure to call ahead and get detailed instructions on how to arrive to the hotel b/c it can be somewhat confusing. Make sure to get off at the Saint Marks Plaza and not Zaccaria. Lastly, the breakfast in the morning was very good especially the sugar coated pastries with some sort of jelly in the middle. I would recommend this hotel and I hope your stay will be as enjoyable as mine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TaxProf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ruzzini Palace during the Venice International Film Festival (where our son had a short film accepted for screening). Our room was spacious, quiet, and very comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful in recommending restaurants, things to do, and how to get to places. Breakfasts were excellent. The location was great (very quiet and close enough to all the sights). We hope to return some day -- it was a wonderful five days.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, a bit far to walk from the water bus station with luggage”
Reviews.Author: Zhilin
Reviews.Content: Venice, in general, is expensive and a big tourist trap. We got charged EURO100 for a fresh sea bass one night at a restaurant in Venice. It is also the only city in Italy we visited to charge a heavy service charge (13-20%) to the bill when dinning in restaurants. The water taxi wanted EURO60 from the Venice train station to the Ruzzini Palace Hotel! The Hotel itself is nice and has everything you need. The room was romantic and has a lot of characteristics. The bed was soft and the bathroom was big. It is near the Realtor square. But if you arrive in Venice for the first time and have lots of luggage, then I won't recommend this hotel. It is a good 10minutes walk from the Realtor water bus station and cross several bridges. So with a heavy luggage, it wasn't easy to get there. There are so many hotels in Venice, I'd recommend people to stay at hotels near the water bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms - great atmosphere"”
Reviews.Author: frequentlyaround
Reviews.Content: There have been some minor problems with the room. I was happy to have them sorted with an upgrade. Friendly staff. Good position. Quite good breakfast. Efficient concierge desk. Plus: Dramatic rooms tastfully decorated Position Super tasty croissants Excellent common areas Minus: Cleaning can be improved. Small rooms are not so nice

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma101110
Reviews.Content: I chose the Ruzzini Palace after reading other excellent reviews and I was not disappointed. I booked 3 nights in Venice as a surprise 40th birthday present for my husband and it couldn't have been better. The room was amazing, really big for mid-city and even had a separate sitting area, and the bed was super comfortable. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet was again excellent. The hotel is located in a really pretty palazza and is only about 5-10 min walk from either St Marks Square and Rialto Bridge. Very central but not at all noisy. Highly recommended - we will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and professional staff, good location in a quiet square.”
Reviews.Author: rpc1547
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in other so-called 4 star hotels in Venice which were awful in comparison with the Ruzzini. The establishment borders on 5 star standard, just lacking some of the facilities that would qualify it for such a rating. I endorse all the other positive reviews and was very impressed with our room/suite. If you are travelling in a family group, this may well be the hotel for you as our room could be discretely connected to an adjoining room via a corridor (keeping the kids just far enough away!). I would also recommend paying for a water taxi transfer from the dock at the airport. Ours cost 100 Euro, but it is well worth budgeting for. However, I would suggest negotiating to make sure you can be transferred to the hotel via the Grand Canal - to get the most out of the experience. The location of the Ruzzini Palace makes for an easy transfer from the airport for the water taxi, as it can be accessed quickly via a side canal, so you won't get to see much. The Ruzzini also arranged for us to share a return transfer with other guests @ 90 Euro between 4 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: BhellFibla
Reviews.Content: You have to "get lost" in Venice; this hotel is in a very nice area, and you can go walking everywhere. The rooms are very clean, large and the bed is sooo soft... The bathroom is very good also! My biggest problem was: the air conditioner. My room was extremely hot, I couldn't get to sleep, so I call the front desk because I thought that my temperature sensor was not working... and they told me that the air conditioner was central, so they could not low the temperature; the guy told me: "open the window". It was hell to sleep, because in the plaza in front of the hotel everynight a bunch of people just hang there making a lot of noise - and the room was STILL very hot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cm7872
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. Our room was very nice and I was taken aback by the large assortment of food that they had for the breakfast buffet. The buffet is included in the room price. We arrived by water taxi and departed by water taxi to the ship pier for a cruise. The hotel people said the night before we parted that often times they will match guests up with other guests to share the same water taxi to the pier. They did this for us and the cost of the water taxi to the hotel was half its normal cost. That was a nice unexpected perk for staying there. There was also a flea market in the huge plaza in front of the hotel on Saturday. The vendors had a large assortment of merchandise and I found it very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: camillekm
Reviews.Content: We arrived by water taxi to the private dock at Ruzzini Palace. From the time we arrived everything was taken care of. We walked into a lovely lobby and were warmly greeted by the gentleman working at the desk. He told us our reservation had been changed and he hope that was okay with us, they were able to upgrade us to a better room. It was fantastic. Huge lovely ceilings, Murano glass sculpture in the room, plenty of storage. The room looked out onto the square which we found wonderful. We got to watch life streaming by in the square. The room was comfortable, spotlessly clean--and I'm a stickler for that. The bathroom was lovely and well appointed. The room was so large, much larger than most European hotel rooms. It was peaceful and wonderful and so lovely to come back to at the end of our site-seeing days. It rained while we were there but the hotel provided umbrellas to take and we were delighted by that thoughtful touch. The breakfasts were good and plentiful. The staff was friendly and helpful, making reservations for us. They all spoke excellent English and that made our visit so much better and easier. The lounge was never busy in the afternoon but it offered a nice place to get off my feet and have a glass of wine and write in my travel journal, write postcards or read. The wine offered by the glass was good quality. I would absolutely recommend this hotel. It exceeded our expectations and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Manxtraveller66
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day late to Venice, because of our local Airport being closed due to snow. The hotel kept our reservation active until we arrived as I stayed in email contact with them to let them know when we would be arriving. Our arrival was welcomed by front desk staff and nothing was too much trouble. After a few minutes there was a knock on the door and a butler presented us with a complimentary bottle of Prosecco which was lovely! For what we payed for our booking this hotel was amazing!! Fantastic views of the Campanile in St Mark's Square from our room which was a double superior room. Breakfast was very nice, included scrambled eggs and bacon..even Prosecco was on offer. Coffee was to die for and plenty of it. We went out every evening for dinner and drinks but found the hotel's bar a better value by far along with complimentary nibbles. The coffee at night was a better value as well. Ask the desk about where to eat that won't cost a arm or leg to eat at, they sent us to 2 places that were very reasonable and not very far from the hotel. The first day there we went to find lunch. Even after researching on the Net about where, what and how to eat in Venice we still got taken. A little cafe/restaurant ran by 2 woman just over a small bridge. The room only had about 5 tables in this little cafe. We had 2 small bowls of soup, 1 plate of pasta, 2 coffee's and a bottle of water and it cost 46 Euros. When we got the receipt there were 3 charges for each item!!!.. I wished I had taken a photo of the place to warn people about the charges. You won't be sorry if you stay at this hotel. Beautiful surroundings and lovely staff make it a fantastic holiday!

Reviews.Title: “The most charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tessandom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ruzzini Palace Hotel in Janaury 2010, it was just magic! Has to be one of my favourite hotels ever. The front of house staff were amazing, we were booked into another hotel outside the city (a nightmare) and stumbled upon the Ruzzine by chance whilst strolling around the city one Sunday. From our first signt of the hotel I was hooked. We got a good deal and a free upgrade to a really beautiful room with a view over the square, The entire experience was teriffic. We will return to Venice and to the Ruzzini Palace again and again! From location to service to value to charm, this hotel has everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: eatdrinklaugh
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on TA reviews and weren't disappointed. Booked directly through hotel website and were upgraded to a huge suite with a balcony. Loved the location. I agree with some of the other reviewers in that you may want to skip the gondola and take a water taxi to the hotel, it cost us 70E but was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Romuald78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great !!! We had a mini vacation of 3 days in Venice and we were so glad that we have chosen Ruzzini for our stay. We had a deluxe room, spacious and beautifully decorated and bathroom was also very nice. Breakfast was very good and complete, including champagne and strawberries. The location is amazing - in a large piazzeta, away from the crowd, yet in a very central position. The staff was polite and kind. Ruzzini is a real palace, beautiful and elegant and if will return to Venice we would surely accommodate again at Ruzzini . Words can not describe enough this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect.”
Reviews.Author: possiblyaprincess
Reviews.Content: Ruzzini Palace Hotel is ideally located and a very stylish establishment. The experience of catching a water taxi to the steps of the hotel should be a must for all travelers (spend your euros on that rather than a gondola ride). We stayed in a standard room tucked up in the rafters and it was very comfortable and cleverly appointed to take advantage of the limited space. The view was wonderful. The tea-making facilities and desk nook were appreciated. The breakfast was delicious and the waiting staff were friendly and helpful and all spoke English. So the Ruzzini Palace gets most things right. My only quibble is that my booking supposedly included free wifi and a free welcome drink. When we arrived I had to argue with the reception staff member until he (reluctantly) agreed to let me have 24 hours free access (when we were booked in the hotel for three days). Needless to say, no free welcome drink was forthcoming. Why advertise these 'extras' if you are not going to honour them? (Free wifi really should be a standard feature of any good hotel in 2010.) I didn't need a drink and would not normally expect one but given that it was prominently advertised it made me feel peevish when it wasn't forthcoming. Perhaps we caught this staff member on a bad day or perhaps only guests staying in the superior rooms get the red carpet treatment? Despite these minor criticisms, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to other travelers. Just be ready to stand up for your entitlements.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with AMAZING SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: jtssea
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and I stay in many hotels for work as well -but no hotel has ever exceeded The Ruzzini Palace Hotel for Service! NONE! They were amazing in person and via email! I was able to plan a lot prior to the trip via email where they secured all of our restaurant resservations as well as water taxi's and grand canal tour. It was like a dream in that every single front desk and concierge person was superb and genuine! There is a person at the desk 24hours a day ready and able to help in any way! They even had a bagged breakfast for our early 4am departure! Speaking of breakfasts a very nice hot and cold buffet is included everyday. The breakfast room was quiet and had plenty of seating. There was even prosecco and lattes included every morning. Additionally Michael in the bar was charming and and made nice cocktails. The location is wonderful because it is a short distance to The Rialto and St Marks Sq. The rooms are wonderful for their size and appointments. There is plenty of open space too but without the feel of a huge hotel. On both of our stays our rooms were wonderful! The only 2 suggestion would be to have super luxurious matresses to go with the feel of the hotel but they were nonetheless a notch above most. Secondly a bigger bar of soap for the shower instead of the same size as for the sink. When these are the only 2 issues at a hotel all isgood...coupled with al the above mentionings this place was wonderful and memeorable. It was one oif the highlights of our 3 week trip. We went with another couple who echoed our praises. We will be back to Venice and we wil be thrilled to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and effortlessly romantic”
Reviews.Author: fers1977
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend whisked me away to the Ruzzini Palace in the heart of Venice for my birthday. The hotel is grand looking, clean, classically Venetian and staff friendly and helpful. Our room faced the Square and was nicely decorated with a separate dressing room and bathroom and had beautiful exposed wooden beams on the ceiling. My only criticisms would be that 1) as beams adorned the ceiling, the room had no ceiling light and, as such, was quite poorly lit esp in the evenings and 2) due to the design of and natural slope of the building, when walking close to the windows the floor shook slightly. Even with this in mind, we had peace, quiet and comfort and good breaksfasts every morning. The hotel can arrange most things for guests inc. water taxis to Marco Polo Airport, advice and bookings re Gondola's/motor boats and even run a private complimentary water taxi service to the island of Murano (but be prepared for the hard sell re buying glass and crystal). They also run a return boat service back to San Marco from Murano. If you want to look around the island you'll have to take the public waterbus back. Also for a hotel of its class, I didn't think â‚¬4 was a bad price for a decent glass of red wine. What really sells the hotel is its location. Maybe 8 minutes walk to the Rialto Bridge with clear signs and 8 - 10 minutes to the main square. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a quiet location near Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: lovelydreamin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ruzzini Palace Hotel for 3 nights during our honeymoon. As soon as we arrived at the hotel, we were upgraded to a junior suite, which was beautiful. The hotel, which is a renovated palace, has a very interesting history. The staff was helpful, the breakfast was delicious, and the square in which it's located in is quiet but close to the Piazza San Marco. If you are looking for a cheap hotel, this isn't it, but it's worth a splurge. The hotel bar is also well priced -- a glass of house wine is only 4 euro. Overall, a great stay and I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Ruzzini Redux”
Reviews.Author: SteveDesign
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels for this past Italian adventure, the location we most eagerly anticipated, and our final destination was the Ruzzini in Venice. As one who enjoys both traditional historic and also modern hotels, I was eager to experience the morphing of the two styles at one property. When well done, this can be an exceptionally stimulating and appealing environment. The property appeared in some way, a bit â€œsoulessâ€� for me (and I really appreciate minimalist modern architecture so itâ€™s not that it was too modern). The hotel photos give the impression that the public spaces and rooms are enormous, which they are not- at first I almost thought I was in the wrong lobby! We arrived early and were treated to cappuccino (gratis) in the bar area and were upgraded to a room on the upper floor (coincidentally the one that I actually wanted from the website) with small windows but a lovely view toward San Marco. The bath was small but adequate by European standards and the overall feel of the room was both rustic and modern which we very much appreciated. Being newly converted, the finishes are all neat and clean as anticipated although there appeared to be some wear on the room carpet. We visited the beginning of December and the hotel was almost empty which may have contributed to a sense of vacuity which the hotel seemed to have for me. The plus side was that we had the desk staff to ourselves and used their knowledge to experience more than we would have been able on our own- not sure if this would be the case in high season. The hotel has continually increased in its rating and although it is an exceptionally nice property, I canâ€™t believe that it deserves to be ranked so high compared with the other hundreds of options in Venice. For an off-season rate it was a steal (not sure if these deals are available any longer). Since I donâ€™t have a huge breadth of knowledge about the hotels in Venice, Iâ€™d say you canâ€™t go wrong, but I wouldnâ€™t fret if you didnâ€™t get to stay here- unless you can opt for one of the giant suites.

Reviews.Title: “Aaaaah”
Reviews.Author: Fred_the_needle
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location (but ask at reception for a map, the ones in the rooms are too small), great staff. Booked here based on the reviews on "Trip Advisor". Didn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Attentive Staff, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DeClaired
Reviews.Content: The Ruzzini Palace is the perfect getaway to Venice accomodation. It's small enough to be a gem but looked after like a high end and well reputed luxury hotel. The location on one of the more quiet side canals is perfect for rides right up to the lobby dock (100euros from the airport) or for watching gondola rides go by as you read the morning paper. It has beautiful lounges with rich furniture and decor. Everything is pristine, clean and well taken care of. The breakfast spread is wonderful and there is a small but adequate bar for after dinner cocktails before retiring to your room. The location is a 10 minute stroll to all the action at San Marco and just a few turns from a lot of local boutiques and restaurants. The front desk staff provided us with a map and detailed directions to all the places we were interested in seeing as well as highlighting some restaurants along the way. They also suggested and set up a private boat ride for us in the evening for a complete viewing of the city of Venice by water, as well as a private trip to the island of Murano to check out the glass blowing. We were lucky enough to stay in the Royal Suite which leaves you feeling nothing shy of royalty. The bed is beyond heaven, your own salon for lounging with windows opening on the Plaza and windows over the canals on the other will leave us wanting to come back very very soon. Thank you Ruzzini (and Mario!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ranmalie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with anthoer couple and I have nothing but the best to say about Ruzzini Palace. We had a deluxe double room and it was amazing! Spacious, clean and beautifully decorated. The staff were courteous and friendly. The Concierge, Fredrico was one of the best! The breakfast was very good, and had hot and cold dishes. The Bar was great and Michael the barman was real fun to talk to and treated us special!! We would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sprintLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from celebrating our 25th Wedding anniversary in Venice. We stayed at the Ruzzini Palace Hotel and would advise anyone wanting a beautiful hotel, with friendly and excellent service to stay at the Ruzzini. Although a four star it is really 5 star, but does not earn the extra star beacuse it does not have all the big hotel trimmings such as a spa, etc. However the level of service, room and general feel of the hotel is certainly five star. From the moment you walk in you are greeted by warm smiles and a sense of pride in the hotel from the staff. Our classic room was super, large with an excellent bathroom. Breakfast was really good and served by friendly staff. The hotel is just outside the main area, only a few hundred yards, which is good as the noise levels are low. Use the Ruzzini; it is simply super! Simone on reception was a star, but they all were. Adrian & Hayley Barker 24th - 28th Sept 2010

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Blend”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: Trying to stay in a grand Venetian hotel is not easy. It is costly, and most of the hotels that fall into this category are indeed grand, but also dark and worn around the edges. This hotel solves that problem by offering you the best of both old and new architecture, and design. The hotel is located on the edge of a large open square in an overall quiet location. It is an easy walk to the main sites of Venice, provided of course, you do not get lost in the maze that makes the city so charming and special. On the backside of the hotel is a canal, which means the hotel has its own dock that is entered through double doors in the small stylish lobby. The classic Venetian structure is attractive with a grand salon room on the second floor complete with beautiful Murano chandeliers. We stayed in a junior suite which was very nice and impressive looking. The large one room suite was in a corner on the backside of the hotel. From the side window we could see the bell tower in St Marks Square, and a bridge over the canal. The two windows that directly fronted the canal did not provide a view of the canal because the windows had deep ledges, so we could not lean out far enough to see the canal which was close to the building. Regardless, the side windowâ€™s view more than made up for it. The room had lots of features not found in most hotel rooms including a twenty foot beamed ceiling. The walls were fabric covered with nice art work hung on them. White modern furniture filled the room, and abundant lighting offered different mood settings. As with many Venice hotels, the floor was a speckled stone. A nice desk area was tucked away in one corner. The bathroom was an oval shaped room that you actually could almost walk completely around, not attached to an outside wall of our room, directly behind the bed. The bathroom itself was nice but did not have any wow factor compared to the room. It also had a glass panel that was too small so it did not hold the water back during a shower, resulting in a wet floor. It should be noted that each room in the hotel is different in size and ceiling height. Also the square in the front of the hotel attracts young kids that play soccer after school, and we wondered how that affected rooms overlooking the square. We had breakfast each morning at the hotel. The buffet breakfast was basically the standard European breakfast and it is served in two rooms off the lobby that are modern and nice looking. The first of the two rooms doubles as a small bar that is available to guests until about 11pm. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful and always willing to provide the information you need. Through the hotel we arranged for a tour of a Murano glass factory, taking the the factoryâ€™s private boat directly from the hotelâ€™s dock. We also splurged taking a water taxi to the airport which was fun and one of those memorable experiences that we were very glad we did. The hotel has the elegance of a grand Venetian hotel, but with nice modern and cool touches that make it unique and different. The small size, nice staff, and good location all combine to make this great choice for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: janeybgood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ruzzini Palace from 21 - 25 September 2010, having flown from Edinburgh. We found the hotel easily as we had a map and had been to Venice before, and we arrived in daylight - it 's in a huge airy square unlike many Venice hotels which are tucked up dark alleys. The reception staff (all male) were very helpful - they checked us in efficiently and our luggage was taken to our room on the first floor. This was a room overlooking the canal - I was slightly disappointed at first as I thought I would prefer overlooking the square - but being on the canal was fabulous! In a city without roads and vehicles, everything happens by boat. While brushing my teeth in the bathroom I could look thru the window and watch gondolas full of tourists floating past (some with on-board violinists!), barges delivering fruit and veg to the hotel, businessmen in suits going to and from work motoring past in their own private boats, I even saw a funeral on the canal one morning. Totally fascinating - some days I didn't want to leave the hotel as there was so much variety of life passing the window of my room! The bedroom was very comfortable - no storage space but we had a separate dressing room with a safe in the wall. Breakfast was lovely and plentiful - gorgeous coffee and warm croissants and the best scrambled egg I've ever tasted. There is a beautiful salon on the 2nd floor with amazing wooden beams on the ceiling and frescos on the walls. There are fabulous Murano chandeliers in this room, though they were never switched on. On the day we left we treated ourselves to a private water taxi from the hotel jetty straight to the airport. Not cheap, but the perfect end to our trip and we felt very special speeding along on this huge boat all by ourselves - our driver was determined to overtake all the other boats and we got to the airport with time to spare. Venice is beautiful - the canals DO NOT smell, the weather was glorious - but it is very very expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in venice”
Reviews.Author: merosa
Reviews.Content: We stayed this summer with my family (2 children). The hotel is well located in a relatively quite Campo. We stayed at the suite paradiso, which is superb!, high ceilings, well-maintained (in fact the hotel is brand-new), very clean, good views, and spacious...like a real palace. The staff is friendly and warm (they helped us when my 8 year-old child dropped-off the canal) (thank you, Antonnella...!). This was my seventh time in Venice; I have stayed in 4 & 5 star hotels, and I have to say that Ruzzinni was the best in terms of price-quality ratio, and ideal for families in their suites.

Reviews.Title: “The Ruzzini is great but the staff are even greater!”
Reviews.Author: 2woollyjumpers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Ruzzini to celebrate 42 years of marriage - we couldn't have chosen a better hotel. We arrived by water taxi and were met by hotel staff at their canal entrance. We were checked in by a very friendly member of staff and shown to our Junior Suite on the first floor. A large, marble floored room with tasteful decor and twin beds pushed together as one King. Adequate bathroom (shower over bath) complete with bidet. We overlooked the quiet Campo di Santa Maria Formosa. As other reviews have mentioned, it's a wonderful tranquil area away from the hustle and bustle of St Marks and the Rialto, yet, you can be in the land of tourist groups in minutes. Our hotel 'anniversary package' meant we had a complimentary bottle of Prosecco which accompanied us on our hour long romantic gondola ride which we booked via the hotel. What we cannot emphasise enough is the wonderful staff that work on reception in The Ruzzini. Their dedication, helpfulness and friendliness to us was above and beyond any hotel staff we have ever encountered throughout the world. Mille grazie Ruzzini Hotel, especially one member of staff who seemed to be on the desk night and day throughout our 4 night stay - he even waved us goodbye as we left by water taxi, thank you very much Signor.

Reviews.Title: “Very special!”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneSam
Reviews.Content: We booked this place because of TA reviews and again, came up trumps. We decided to take a private water taxi from the station to the hotel as this would substitute our Gondola ride. Iâ€™m so glad we did as we would have never found it (with luggage) on our own. The private jetty of the hotel is very swish and gives you a fantastic â€œVeniceâ€� experience to start you trip. The staff were very attentive in helping us and our luggage out of the taxi. As our room wasnâ€™t ready, they happily took our bags and gave us some very useful tips on restaurants and other excursions they could privately book for us. We booked 2 restaurants through them based on their recommendations and were very pleased with their choices. The room itself was enormous!!!! It had a lovely cool marble floor coupled with the dark red and gold soft furnishing and the dark mahogany furniture â€“ fantastically regal! We had a HUGE bathroom with double sinks and deep tub and then to top it off, a little sitting area / mini walk in wardrobe! I loved that as it meant we could hide our suitcases out of the way and have so much room to ourselves. The breakfast was fabulous, really well sticked and enough to keep you going all day although the staff were a little slow with the coffee order. In the evening, we were offered a free drink but unfortunately had to go back to reception to remind someone to attend to the bar. Overall this place is great. A lovely hotel out of the way of the hustle and bustle of the main tourist areas. The piazza where it is located it really great too with some great little cafes for lunch which shouldnâ€™t be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, centrally located piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: diamondgirl22
Reviews.Content: The Ruzzini Palace is a typical European Hotel. The lobby is small but well decorated. You can arrive directly at their dock from the airport by private transportation via a boat.This eliminates dragging your suitcases from the Rialto Bridge which is not close. The buffet breakfast each morning is generous,offering breads,cheeses,fruits, meats, cereals and yogurts. There is no other food service however. They have a bar that opens in the afternoon for drinks. Wireless internet works well and depending on the room type chosen, can be free. The hotel itself is located on a square,which hosts a flea market on Sundays and farmers market other days. Although it is in a quiet area, it is very convenient to San Marcos and the Rialto Bridge area. Both areas that are quite lively. We were in one of the largest rooms offered and had a balcony directly over the small canal. It had a large separate livingroom,with LCD flat screen TV,couch,2 chairs and a round table with 4 chairs. The bedroom had a LCD TV and a king bed, which was quite hard, but didn't stop us from getting a good nights sleep. The bathroom has one sink and roomy tub/shower. The front desk staff go above and beyond in answering all questions,arranging reservations,giving directions and maps. We have stayed at 4 and 5 star hotels all over Europe and would not hesitate to recommend the Ruzzini Palace.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BusymumRotherham
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary, so we decided to go to Venice and I chose the Ruzzini Palace hotel. It is in a quiet courtyard off the beaten track a bit, so you can sleep well after your sightseeing. It is still not too far away from the main attractions though. The room was nicely furnished and the bed was very comfortable. We had nice touches like toilletries and even slippers in our room. The mini bar was well stocked, but quite pricey. The continental breakfast was good, plenty of choice.The staff on the reception desk spoke excellent english and were very knowledegable about Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, spacious, attentive”
Reviews.Author: TechnoProf
Reviews.Content: A frist experience in Venice. Like many places you HAVE to arrived by water taxi to enjoy the full experience of this special small but grand hotel. Opted for two suite rooms with nice view to square. Quiet and convenient location, clean. Rooms good (slightly variable service levels in terms of tea, water, service items). Breakfast provided (good) and evening bar. Internet available for reasonable fee. Certainly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ruzzini Palace - very good”
Reviews.Author: Seismo_mid
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night in Ruzzini prior to a cruise. It is a very good choice for location and quality of lodging. The front desk staff were very helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions. We took advantage of their transportation service from the airport to the hotel and it worked beautifully. There is just something luxurious about having someone meet you at the airport and to be transported directly to the hotel. It is expensive, but for us worth it. The breakfast is good. The internet is an additional fee and you must be set up with a login by a staff member. It seemed a bit overly cumbersome. We were upgraded on our room. It was nice, but somewhat small with a portion having a very low ceiling. As seems to be common in Europe, the shower really isn't. I lowered the rating to 4 out of 5 due to the internet and the shower. However, these are really minor observations and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Chrispy14
Reviews.Content: Although this biulding has been restored it still reflects an elegance of times past. We were treated very well by the staff who gave us a tour of the biulding and explained the history of this Venice landmark. They also supplied us with some written information which we will past on to our immediate family and friends. The third floor ballroom and it's balconies, facing the canal on one side and Santa Maria Square on the opposite side, are a wonderful spot in the evenings. Four days here was not enough and we will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to Begin our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: rlball
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up to the entrance in a water taxi, I knew I was in love. This used to be the palace of the first president there and u could tell. It was perfectly located. Nice quiet area and yet within a few blocks you were in the middle of shopping and wonderful restaurants. Massimiliano and Mario were so helpful and friendly. The room was beautiful with an amazing requested view of the canal. :) The windows opened wide in both the bedroom and bathroom. It was fantastic! You could here the gondolas and quiet Italian chatter beneath the room. Very romantic. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom53
Reviews.Content: When my daughter suggested we spend our three nights in Venice here, I went to my normal sources for reviews - Tripadvisor, of course, but also the well-known travel websites. There were great reviews on Tripadvisor, but no mention elsewhere. I thought that was strange but the reviews were so glowing and the price so competitive that I booked here. When we arrived at this beautiful building on the Campo S. Maria Formosa, I found the answer to the puzzle. The hotel only opened two years ago! Since then it has garnered almost 200 reviews, most of them "excellent." I am happy to say that these reviewers were absolutely right. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a friendly and helpful reception staff, all of whom speak excellent English. We booked two rooms, a double for my husband and myself, and a junior suite for the young adults. You don't spend a lot of time in your hotel room in a place like Venice, so the fact that our double was small and dark didn't really bother us much. The bed was very comfortable and it was spotlessly clean. The suite, on the other hand, was absolutely beautiful, with 15 foot ceilings and more than enough room for the third bed we needed. The hotel's public spaces were tastefully furnished and evocative of an elegant past. Breakfast was served downstairs in the small bar area, and was very nicely done. A minor gripe: I personally hate paying for internet access and the hotel charged 12 euros a day for it. One of the nicest features of this hotel was its location. Venice in the summer is full of tourists and the narrow streets around San Marco can leave you feeling jostled and frayed. The Ruzzini Palace is very close to San Marco (10 minute walk), but in terms of the crowds, it feels like a world away. The campo is a large open space with a lovely old church and a few cafes. No trinket stores and no crowds until you get to the calles that branch away from it. What a pleasant way to experience Venice! Thank you Ruzzini Palace Hotel and thank you Tripadvisor for bringing us there!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, Great location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChristianSchmidt
Reviews.Content: We visited from Denmark in late July 2010. We found the hotel on TripAdvisor and booked 3 nights. This was my 5th trip to Venice and we wanted a quiet hotel not too far from the "action" in Venice (I.e Canale Grande, St. Marcus Square and the Rialto Bridge). Arrived by boat-taxi (approx â‚¬70) and was greeted by the professional and friendly staff speaking fluently English. The rooms were gigatic with 6 meters or more to the ceiling, boasting great taste, charming decor and just plain enjoyable. For a hotel without a real restaurant (you can however get an excellent breakfast) and with no spa / fitness facilities the Ruzzini Palace ranks very high on my list of hotels I have visited through the years. It's quiet, well run and situated in a great location on a small piazza, from which you can reach The Rialto Bridge or the St. Markus Square in 5 minutes (walking naturally - it's Venize). We asked for recommandations for a nice and good place to dine and were recommended two restaurants. Again the staff was spot on. The dining for the 3 night we visited Venice was fantastic (quality food, great wine and charming setting). So if you're visiting do not hesitate to ask for nice places to dine. We also asked the concierge for help with a gondola and that was arranged and prepaied from the front desk. The price is approx â‚¬100 and eventhough it may sound a bit "kitch", do not cheat your self out of this true Venezian experience. If you're visiting from the US and have tried the gondola trip at the Venezian in Vegas, you should definitely try the "real-thing" here in Venice. We checked out and left with the boat-taxi which came promptly when ordered at the front desk with great memories of Venice and a very charming hotel at a nice location. You will not be dissapointed staying here! PS: Previous to your arrival by car - call the hotel and have them book a place to park at the private garage San Marco - but call well in advance of your arrival. Otherwise the public parking is not bad at all and they normally have amble availability. And when in Venice, take the Vaporetto (line 1 or 2) all the way around the Venezian bay. That way you will see the city from a distance and close up when travelling through Canale Grande.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: AAA04
Reviews.Content: This is a great modern hotel close to the main attractions in Venice, such as the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square. We had a little difficulty finding it when we arrived in Venice but once there everything seemed easy. The staff are very helpful and are willing to organise trips and recommend restaurants. Breakfast is excellent, as was the view from our top floor room. The room was spotless and the furniture was like new. All reception and restaurant staff spoke good English. We shopped around for a good deal on this accommodation and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: dossy7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Ruzzini Palace for two nights during our stay in the beautiful city of venice. After making our way through the narrow streets with our cases from the Water Bus stop at St Marks we arrived in the Piazza San Formosa with the imposing Ruzzini Palace looking out. We entered the hotel and were greeted by Massimiliano the softly spoken and supremely helpful receptionist who made us feel very welcome. Our room was beautiful and very quirky with the bathroom being central to the room. The hotel had a wonderful relaxing effect and was quiet. The location was perfect for exploring the city mid way between the Rialto bridge and St Marks square. Throughout our stay the hotel were more than helpful and hopefully if we return to Venice we will return to the Ruzzini as it was worth every single penny!

Reviews.Title: “Cool haven in the jostling of Venice in July”
Reviews.Author: originofalphabet-com
Reviews.Content: Ruzzini Palace is as fantastic as the other reviews have claimed. A cool haven in the bustling and jostling of Venice in July. You do need a map to get there. If you follow the instructions on their website, you can find Ruzzini Palace fairly easily. You can also pay a gondolier about 80 euros (7/10) to take you there. Simone at the front desk was really kind and helped me with a restaurant, calling a water taxi, and letting my family tour the palace (it is stunningly beautiful, with fairy glass chandeliers), even though I had checked out by the time my family showed up (we were going on a cruise, and I had come before them). The room I hadâ€”103â€”had two small balconies which overlooked a canal frequented by gondolas. Just watching the slow passage of tourists was a dream. It was a large room for one or two, with a great shower and big flat screen TV and elegant furnishings. I even took a picture of the actual floor because it was like a smooth slice of composite marble or granite with mother of pearl glinting every now and then as I walked from the closet around the room to the office space where there was a mini bar and makings for tea and coffee. The hotel was so peaceful after the mania of San Marcos Square and because I was clueless enough to haul my luggage there. Had I realized how many stair-step bridges there were, I would have paid the gondolier. I will next time. The breakfast was wonderful, and I wished that I had booked longer than one night. I plan to come back with my husband next year for our 25th wedding anniversary, because Venice is a very happy, wonderful, musical place, and I like the person I am when I'm there.

Reviews.Title: “Best luxury hotel in Venice for our family of 4!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler 300
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The hotel overlooks a huge plaza called the Santa Maria Formosa. What a perfect location. The plaza has tons of eating places and so much goes on there. The hotel is within walking distance to everything. San Marco plaza and the Ponte Vechio are only a short 5-7 minute walk. This is also one of the few hotels that faces a plaza, but also has the back of the hotel on a canal. This is a huge plus as you can take a water taxi that can stop at the back of the hotel and you never have to drag your bags around the streets going or coming to the hotel from the airport or train station. Good if you have a lot of luggage that isnâ€™t very portable or if walking is a bit of a challenge. Itâ€™s door to door service! We took a Vaporetto (water bus) from the airport to the hotel. The vaporetto was cheaper than a taxi (only 13 euros per person from the aiport, as a private water taxi from the airport was 100 euros) We got off on the Rialto stop, and walked about 5 minutes, but had very portable bags. Checking out of the hotel, we had to go to the train station and decided to try a water taxi as the train station is closer. The hotel called us a water taxi and it was 70 euros. It was a such a plush water taxi that had beautiful woodgrain and was pristine inside. The location is perfect as you are in a square. A couple streets down is a small grocery store and also a self service laundrymat which we used. If you go there, they will wash your clothing for you for a small fee or you can do it yourself. We travel very light, so we found this very helpful. ROOM: First of all, the rooms are immaculate and clean with tons of light. Ceiling to wall windows with beautiful fabrics and wall treatments. We had room 302 which had a queen bed and single bed and also the connecting room (which is beautiful living room). They made the living room sofa into a king bed so that there was space for 4 of us. Together the two rooms were like an opulent apartment and we did feel like we were in a palace. The â€œSquare Suiteâ€� faces the square (Santa Maria Formosa) and the square suite has THE ONLY Room BALCONY facing the square. The other balcony is a common area in between hotel rooms. My kids felt like royalty going out onto the huge balcony and looking at the square. If you get the suite that faces the canal, I am sure it is nice too, but the canal is so narrow, that you pretty much see the next building more than anything. The view out of our window went all the way to San Marco Square. Amazing. The main room also had a small dedicated office area. Basically a long desk that was behind the queen bed. My husband used this when he had to take a couple calls and hook up his laptop. If you need internet connectivity, they give you a card you purchase for either an hour or 24 hours. This is pretty standard. BATHROOM: The bathroom is very nice, although no windows. It is right as you walk in the door to the room and the rest of the room surrounds the bathroom. BREAKFAST: Breakfast was wonderful and huge! It is in a very bright room and it is much more than a continental breakfast. Every morning they had scrambled eggs and bacon, in addition to everything else you would expect (yogurt, pastries, toast, cereals). The service is great at breakfast and it was one of the better breakfasts in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: danlindasam
Reviews.Content: My 13 yr old daughter and I traveled all over Europe this summer for a month...the Ruzzini Place was our favorite. Luxurious, clean, convenient location, yet quiet - if that sounds like what you want...then this is the place. Francesco, Ahmed and Mike the bartender were our favorites. The Continental breakfast was the best deal we got during our travels....this is a place that can't be beat!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT SERVICE, IDEAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: kris55550
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 2 night stay, we took a water taxi (be prepared for the cost) from the airport straight to the hotel door, we enjoyed the ride. The hotel was lovely, we upgraded to a suite which was just fab. The staff bought up a bottle of Champagne within a few mins of our arrival to wish us a happy anniversary. The staff were really helpful and happy to tell us about places to visit and mark them on the map. We had an excellent meal at SANGAL which i would highly recommend for a special treat. The spagetti carbonara was amazing in Venice :) I would highly recommend hotel as only about 5-7 mins walk to main square but far enough away to have some peace and quiet as well. The breakfast was good, not lots of choice but all fresh and plenty enough to fill up on for a day of walking!! I would defo recommend a gondalo ride with serenade for the experience. The handbag shops are amazing so take plenty of money. We will certainly visit Ruzzini again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay for a special break”
Reviews.Author: IanWCampbell
Reviews.Content: A tastefully refitted Venetian palace with superb friendly service and great organisation. We found this hotel delightful, well situated, yet also quiet. Breakfasts were great and the staff could not do enough to help.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: bemac19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night and our room was upgraded to the royal suite. Wow what a great room. The staff was very friendly and professional. Will definitely return to this hotel on my next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience! Authentic, great location, knowledgable staff”
Reviews.Author: Hudsontraveller
