Reviews.Content: We had only 4 days in Venise; the knowledgable and interested staff suggested and arranged for tickets to an Opera in a private palace! and a string concert in a beautiful church, a memorable night of Vivaldi. The staff insisted that we take the boat tour of Venice,which they arranged; when we settled into the boat there was a bottle of chilled champagne waiting for us, it was like a dream.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem, exceeded all expectations.”
Reviews.Author: ohniner
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Venice (many to Italy before) and relied on Trip Advisor to select Ruzzini Palace Hotel. The rooms are absolutely huge by any standard and updated to current standards yet maintains the high end luxury feel one desires in this price range. The staff were extremely helpful, friendly and fluent in english. Mario stood out above the rest. Perfect location on quiet square with great nearby restaurants, Gondola station and its own dock on a canal. No carrying luggage, huge in Venice. You would be nuts to stay near St Marks square; crazy crowds, tourist trap restaurants and very busy Grand Canal. I would rate it 5 stars and #1 in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “They were not truthful.”
Reviews.Author: 510bunter
Reviews.Content: After I made our reservation, I sent the hotel an email telling them that it was important that we have a shower-their website suggests they be contacted via email with questions or requests. They wrote back saying our (de luxe) room would have a shower. The room did not have a shower. They said we could have a room with a shower if we paid $100 extra for a junior suite. I showed them our email exchange and they were unimpressed saying it was the architect's design. At our next hotel we inquired about the shower and they were astonished that we would ask. They said it was a "normal shower" This is the 21st century and this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel. There is no confusion between a bath and a shower. This is not part of my complaint about this hotel, but I did let them know in my email that this was a special trip for us-a big birthday for my husband and a big anniversary for both of us. Our Rome hotel greeted us with chilled prosecco and a lovely card. The Ruzzini Palace gave us a hard time. Because of the deception and the way they handling the situation, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superior accomodations and flawless service”
Reviews.Author: 23Feb45
Reviews.Content: The Ruzzine Palace Hotel provided me with superior accomodations and flawless service throughout my three night visit. During my two week visit to Italy, I stayed in seven hotels and this was by far my favorite. The hotel's lobby has direct access to a canal (110 Euro water taxi from the airport). The front desk staff is very experienced, professional, and helpful. My room was upgraded to a huge suite (#302) that included 20 foot beamed ceilings, chandeliere, balcony with a view of the square, very clean bathroom, desk, safe, mini bar, coffee, two LCD TV's, robes, slippers, toiletries, and what appeared to be an HD DVD player. The hotel was full of Murano glass. The common areas were spacious and clean. The breakfast room had the best decor I've seen in Italy. The included breakfast was the standard Europeon continental breakfast. Dining recommendations for lunch and dinner were very good. The directions and maps were difficult to understand so I was constantly lost trying to find my destination and the hotel. The complimentary water taxi to Murano led me into the standard glass blowing demonstration then to a high pressure salesperson trying to sell products in his showroom for prices that exceeded the prices on Venice! Because I made a purchase, I was given a complimentary return taxi ride to Saint Mark's Square (not to my hotel). The hotel was kind enough to arrange a 40 minute gondola ride for 100 Euros. I was told the gondola would pick us up at the hotel, but instead, the gondolier met us at the hotel and walked us accross the palaza to his boat. The front desk provided a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine to help celebrate my wife's birthday. When we checked out, the front desk arranged for a 70 Euro water taxi to drive us to the train station. "Value" in Venice is all relative. My stay at the Ruzzine Palace Hotel was actually one of the best values I recevied during my stay. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and style”
Reviews.Author: Traedmawr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night during June 2010. The hotel faces a nice sunny square, and is near many attractions. If you have large cases, I'd suggest that taking a water taxi to the hotel is a better option than negotiating the labyrinth of streets and bridges from the water bus stop at Rialto. Our rooms (juniour suites) were of regal dimensions, but kitted out in an interesting blend of ultra modern and classic style, which really worked.They were spotlessly clean. Breakfast was fine, and is included, so we were told, in all room rates. The condition of communal areas left something to be desired, with spent laundry etc left quite prominently for long periods in the stairwells and corridors, and the stair carpets were grubby due to ongoing minor restoration work. When booking through the hotel website, the deal was supposed to include various freebies (e.g. a guided tour of Murano glassworks, free drink, free room service), however these did not materialise, except for the great room upgrade for our son, who ended up in a huge suite. We didn't pursue the "freebies" as we were not concerned about them in the least, however, I suggest that they should be offered without the customer having to prompt the matter. An interesting stay in an interesting building, albeit rather expensive for the overall quality delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Excellence”
Reviews.Author: jancv
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Ruzzini Palace Hotel for 5 nights during June. The hotel is situated on a quiet local square that is close to both San Marco and Rialto Bridge, roughly 10mins walk from either. There are lots of "locals" type restaurants which serve excellent food for not a lot of money located in the alleys just off the square for which the staff are more than happy to make recommendations. In Venice it is hard to find anywhere that is not a tourist trap so these recommendations were very welcome. We found everyone of the staff members to be happy, efficient and always ready with information on whatever we needed from weather forecasts and making sure we had umbrellas to the above restaurants and making reservations for us. The rooms (we had 301) were clean, well equipped and spacious. The beds and pillows extremely comfortable. Breakfast was excellent with more than enough choices, both hot and cold, to see you through the day, I think you would be hard pressed to find a more convenient hotel in Venice. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great honeymoon stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: JJD-FRAGGLES
Reviews.Content: My â€˜newâ€™ Husband and I stayed here as part 1 of our honeymoon tour of Italy. We arrived by water taxi from the airport and knew straight away weâ€™d booked a great place. It looks very elegant from both the canal side and the view from the campo Santa Maria Formosa in which it is located. Renovations have been sympathetic which gives this hotel a great Venetian feel. We were given an upgrade to the junior suite which had a great view of a canal from the 2 large doors that opened onto small balconies. We were also given a complimentary bottle of Prosecco which was a nice touch after such a long journey. The staff were incredibly helpful and pleasant â€“ they helped to organise a gondola trip, advised of restaurants and helped us to plan the train to part 2 of our honeymoon. The hotel is perfectly situated 5 -10 mins walk from both St Marks Square and the Rialto. Breakfast was continental with the usual additions of scrambles egg and bacon - more than enough to start the day. The only bad point is that the air con in the room was very noisy although, as we both travel often, we always take earplugs with us so it wasnâ€™t too much of an issue! In summary, there would be no reason for us to stay anywhere else if we ever visited Venice again. The perfect start to our honeymoon. A note about Venice restaurantsâ€¦.. Do your homework before you go. We stayed in Venice for 4 nights and had only 1 good meal, even given the recommendations from the hotel. Most of the restaurant and mediocre at best and are very highly priced given the quality of the food â€“ even those that are so called â€˜off the beaten trackâ€™. The only good meal we had was in the bar at the Metropole hotel â€“ a reasonably prices meal form the same kitchen as the Michelin restaurant on the top for (which Iâ€™m sure would be great but need to book up to 3 weeks in advance!). The choice was limed (only 1 main) but the food was cooked perfectly and with the aperativi and the ambiance of the Moroccan style bar, we had a great evening.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Away from the Crowds”
Reviews.Author: mntraveler46
Reviews.Content: A redone palazzo on a quiet square a few minutes from San Marco, this hotel is a gem. Great staff, lovely rooms with terrazzo floors, comfy chairs and great beds. Excellent breakfast buffet, small, pleasant bar, canal-side entrance. Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. A real find.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Richmond238
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet square but within easy walking distance of all the main attractions. We had a lovely room on the top floor with views of the square however the bathroom had no proper shower and if you are staying more than three nights you may struggle with storage......hanging space is very limited. Good internet access. Breakfast is what you would expect from a four star hotel and staff were very helpful and efficient. Has a landing stage so very convenient for water taxi transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, quiet square yet close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTeacups
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, updated rooms, lovely, spacious bathrooms with great lighting, awsome water pressure. Everything you could need for breakfast. The front desk had wonderful suggestions for sites and food. One member was not feeling well and they did all they could to accomodate her. Water taxi stops right in the lobby, this is very helpful in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: bgboyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ruzzini Palace for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon. Booked online through a website for a prepaid deal, paying about EUR235 a night. The good bits first. Location is excellent, 5 minute walk from everything. Erm, thats about it. The not so good bits: this might just have been the room we were given as we had prepaid and so couldnt change but here are some things to be aware of. When is the last time you had a 4* hotel room without a shower? Nice bath, but when I asked about the shower, was informed that only the junior suites had those! They have a hand held thing, buts its so short and the ceiling so low, you have to squat in the bath to use it. Air conditioning. The evenings and nights were warm but not hot - mid to high 20s. The air con was set to 16 or 17 degrees but the room temperature didnt drop below 22 degrees! When I asked about this at reception, I was informed that their air con units will only lower the temperature by about 3 degrees from that outside. We sweated our way through the nights sleeping under only a sheet. Breakfast. Only meal we ate there. Very ordinary. Burnt pastries both days, fruit salad covered in fruit flies. We drank coffee and left it at that. Staff. Hmm. Probably best described as polite. Now, we arent snobs, we arent too fussy. We are mid 30s europeans who have travelled extensively, everything from camping though to business travel, we know what to expect. This hotel was NOT up to standard expected. If you get a good room, it might be better, but maybe it was just ours that was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service !”
Reviews.Author: John1175
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at the Ruzzini Palace Hotel with my wife. I got an excellent deal via an internet booking company and I would say that the hotel did not disappoint. We were located on the 6th floor where the ceilings of the rooms are low in comparison to other levels and I think the rooms are smaller than what has been posted by others on here but given the price I paid, the chacaracter of the room (low wooden beams mixed with modern plasma TV, modern study area) and its cleanliness - I have to say it was excellent value for money. The location of the hotel is perfect and is surrounded by some really nice places to eat. I found the breakfast to be good with plenty of variety. Without doubt however, the service of the staff at reception is the hotels biggest asset. Mario in particular went out of his way to help and all his recommendations were spot on. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to travel to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: essexmember
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel to celebrate a special occasion or just to indulge yourself. My Husband booked this as a surprise trip for my birthday and what a celebration it was! Our Junior Suite (201) was amazing with beautiful views over the Square. It was the biggest room we have ever stayed in with a huge bed, comfy chairs and a fantastic fresco ceiling. There were tea making facilities, a fridge, lovely toiletries and even bathrobes and slippers. Just round the corner from our room was an exquisite salon together with grand piano. Each side of the salon had a balcony one overlooking the square and the other overlooking the canal where you can watch the gondolas going by. All of the staff are friendly and welcoming and want to make sure that you have a memorable stay. As the hotel is small you do receive a personal service and it is not too grand that you feel intimidated by either the surroundings or the staff. We found the breakfast excellent and it was great that it was served until 10.30 am. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from San Marco and the Rialto Bridge. These are best visited in the late afternoon when all the day trippers have gone and an air of quietness descends. Apart from these touristy areas there are many other lovely areas to explore and to discover. Head off with your map but expect to get lost some of the time and you will stumble across some amazing finds that most tourists never get to see. After doing so much walking we found it wonderful to return to the Ruzzini Palace to relax and unwind before going out for an evening meal. There are a number of restaurants a short walk from the hotel. We enjoyed the Trattoria Agli Artisti which is across the Square, over the bridge and a little way down on the right. Most of all we enjoyed the comfort and facilities at the Ruzzini Palace and highly recommend this fantastic hotel which certainly had the wow! factor for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff did all they could to make the stay memorable”
Reviews.Author: Smokeyrobbo
Reviews.Content: Booked purely on the basis of previous reviews here on Tripadvisor and I'm happy to say the hotel did not dissappoint. We arrived in Venice to celebrate my wifes 40th Birthday although we initially disappoiinted with the ground floor room which was unusually lcoated just behind the reception. Still a good six and well appointed but didn't feel right. After enquriing (not complaining) about a room change we were apologetically told there was nothing else available. We arrived back from dinner (the wonderful Alle Testierre) to find a bottle of Prosecco on ice and two glasses in the room. This was not an apology for the room but a recognition that they had spotted it was my wifes birthday in the passport earlier that day. A nice touch! The next morning the reception staff called to say they had another room available. I said not to worry as we had now unpacked and didn't want to cause a fuss. They insisted we take a look as they had been able to upgrade us to a third floor Junior Suite with great views over the square. So whilst I accept this will not happen to everyone it was very welcome and left us with great memories of the staff and the hotel and would not now stay anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: froggb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent , centrally located on the main island and within walking distance of all the major attractions. The buffet breakfast was very good. Staff were very helpful and courteous. They recommended a number of nice restaurants that we tried. If you stay there ask to see the Royal Suite. It is out of this world, would definitely stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautifully renovated, attentive service”
Reviews.Author: taurusCroydon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located for exploring Venice - 5 minutes from St Marks Square and Rialto Bridge. Hotel instructions reasonably good from water bus stopo at Rialto Bridge, but you will get lost during your stay - you just get used to it! However you need to be reasonably fit to lug cases etc up and over the numerous bridges enroute! Obviously if you take water taxi you will be delivered to the door - but at a price! Cost of water bus direct from Marco Polo Airport was 13 euros. We stayed in a Junior suite overlooking the square, great to watch the world go by. The suite had been recently refurbished and everything was immaculate. Great shower & deep bath. Breakfast was a continental buffet however there were always eggs & bacon should you require it. THis was a 50th birthday celebration and the hotel kindly left a bottle of Prosseco to chill for our return on the first evening. A very thoughtful touch. The reception staff were extremely courteous and produced an excellent map of the local area - however as I said above still be prepared to get lost! Thank you Ruzzini for an excellent 3 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Ruzzini Palace...”
Reviews.Author: Gustav_Courbet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Ruzzini Palace Hotel in late April 2010. They upgraded us to a wonderful suite with a great view of the Campo upon arrival. Every restaurant recommendation they provided us was spot on. Additionally, my wife developed a severe tooth ache during our stay. The front desk was able to find her an English speaking dentist who was able to treat her immediately. Within two hours, her tooth was better and her trip wasn't hampered by tooth pain. Our suite was very clean and the rainfall shower was great too. The breakfast was as good as any of the hotels we stayed during our European stay. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “High end hotel without the high price”
Reviews.Author: valorie33
Reviews.Content: Ruzzini was an amazing place to stay. We actually had two rooms that were connected through a large private hallway overlooking the water. I loved the location, the breakfast and the overall stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service in a Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tandannik
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights in April for surprise birthday present for Nicola, unfortunately turned out to be Easter so hotel was probably full though still felt spacious and exclusive. Location is excellent, being sufficiently removed from the thronging masses in Piazza San Marco but within easy walking distance of the main attractions of this beautifully faded city. We booked an evening in the Jazz club (well worth it!) and an evening meal at Osteria Ae Sconte (Also well worth it) through the front desk as the concierge wasn't available, but this wasn't a problem as they were attentive and very helpful. We had room 104 which was clean, cosy but comfortable, with a lovely balcony overlooking a canal, perfect for serenading passing gondoliers. Or throwing water over them..... Breakfast was included and featured a large choice of continental and hot options. Overall, an excellent hotel, expensive by global standards, though probably not by Venetian standards.....

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lucky1Sarasota
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ruzzini Palace on our first trip to Europe. I had contacted the hotel prior to our arrival with transportation questions. Michele, the concierge, gave me several helpful suggestions . We opted for a water taxi which delivered us to the door of the hotel in fashion and while having fun. We were greeted so warmly by the staff. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and recently renovated. The quality of the renovation is impeccable. The room is a good size and the bathroom stunning. They even had dual plugs for 110 and 240. The breakfast was delicious. The thing that sets this hotel apart is the service. We were treated like royalty, like it was our palace! Michele was not going to be there the day we checked out. He knew our next destination was Florence. Michele had taken the time to leave us a map of Florence, restaurant suggestions for lunch and dinner, AND who to ask for at each restaurant. This is a beautiful hotel in a great location with staff that puts it head and shoulders above the rest. We will be going back to Venice and we will be staying at the Ruzzini Palace!

Reviews.Title: “You really made our anniversary very memorable”
Reviews.Author: Curitiba1
Reviews.Content: We had a marvellous suite at the Ruzzini Palace Hotel (15-19th March). It was magnificent! We also want to commend the excellent employees at the hotel. They really made our anniversary very memorable. We give our best recommendations to Ruzzini Palace Hotel

Reviews.Title: “It is true what they all say!”
Reviews.Author: Archiedale
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Ruzzini Palace with my husband and in-laws (in their 80's) for my birthday and their diamond wedding present. We had rooms 404 and 405 - don't think they were an upgrade but were fine although only a view of rooftops. Such friendly staff and although it has been said many times Michele was a star and made our stay most enjoyable. The location could not have been better - just far enough away from the crowds and it was crowded in San Marco and Rialto! Great meals, not cheap but it is Venice. Great transportation from and to airport. Would have no hesitation in returning to Venice and would not even bother to look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Cath999
Reviews.Content: As many other reviewers have said, this is a lovely hotel in a very good location - close enough to the main sites that you never need to walk far, but not too noisy. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Continental breakfast is of a good standard - it was included in my room rate. Got a junior suite (paid for deluxe room, so this was nice) - spacious and characterful. It's not cheap, but nothing in Venice is!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel In Perfect City”
Reviews.Author: Ramster1
Reviews.Content: Thought if this hotel is half as good as its made out on various websites then it'll be great - it wasnt....it was three times as good!!! 10/10 for location, equidistant between Rialto and San Marco and 7min walk to each from hotel, 10/10 for hotel itself, our room was very spacious,clean, well decorated, 11/10 for staff!! Attentitive, helpfull and even laid on bottle of good italian Porsecco on the house when i told them it was my wife's birthday......will definately return when we replenish the bank a/c and will not consider another hotel as i wouldn't think we could a find a better one!! Tony R, Southgate,London

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, treated like a King.”
Reviews.Author: page67
Reviews.Content: I recently proposed to my fiancÃ©e in Venice and I cannot praise Michele Vianello at the Ruzzini hotel highly enough. From the moment we landed in the airport we were treated phenomenally well. Our private transfer to the hotel was fantastic and made us feel so special. The hotel itself was beautiful â€“ our room was spacious and the balcony looked out over the square. But the true star of the show is Michele, I had corresponded with him prior to our trip and he arranged our airport pick-up, a spectacular room and when it came to popping the question he arranged a private gondola pick up from the hotel with a bottle of champagne waiting for us in the gondola. After the proposal we went back to the hotel and Michele arranged dinner in a fantastic restaurant for us. He even phoned ahead and they had complimentary champagne waiting for us. The next day Michele advised us where to go for ring shopping. All in all our trip to Venice was incredible and that is due in no small part to the amazing efforts of Michelle and the other staff of the hotel. We will definitely return â€“ I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! Thanks Michele for all your hard work and thoughtfulness.

Reviews.Title: “Do believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: ALMA_9Hastings
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the great reviews on here and weren't disappointed! The hotel was stunning,beautifully clean and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We have stayed in lots of hotels in different countries and this was one of the best- the location was great easy to get to from water bus stops- Rialto or San Marco. Definitely worth trying the Ruzzini cocktail in the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!”
Reviews.Author: JillytLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time in this hotel and in Venice. The staff where incredible and a big thank you to Michaela who helped my boyfriend plan our engagement (I did say yes!) We arrived by water taxi to the hotel and felt like a superstar, coming out of the boat into the incredible reception area. The chandiliers, marble floor and furnishings make you know that you are in a palace.The room 103 was amazing, very modern but still maintaining the classic feel of the hotel. There where two balconies from where you can watch the passing gondolas from above. There was a DVD player, tea making facilities and the bathroom was lovely they even provide slippers! I never found a speck of dust or dirt anywhere. The hotel was also kind enough to provide a bottle of prossecco. Breakfast was the best I have ever had in italy.With a good slection of food as well as prossecco to enjoy. The location was great not too far away from the Rialto and St Marks square. Lots of bars and restaurants close by. We had stayed in Venice 6 years before and had an great time, this time it was even better thanks to the Ruzzini Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SJ2007
Reviews.Content: Had a short stay here - wish it had been longer! Beautiful, huge room with separate area with table and chairs and tea/coffee making facilities. The bath is beautiful. One of the prettiest rooms we stayed in on our trip. The room smelled amazing too. The staff is VERY nice, warm, friendly and helpful. I thought the breakfast was the best here out of all of our hotels (only exception being the coffee, which was better in Rome because the gentleman at that hotel custom made it for us). The hotel is pretty easy to find. We arrived via air and took the bus to the dopoff point, then picked up a water bus stopping at Rilato, from there you might make a few wrong turns here and there but nothing major. The map on their website is very good. We had the best gelato near the hotel that we had in all of Italy - cant remember the name but I want to say it was near the Hotel Bruno. Stay here and enjoy beautiful Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: mrgmmk
Reviews.Content: Can not recommend this hotel highly enough! The staff are wonderful, so polite and no request too much, breakfast was excellent and far more variety than I've seen in Italian hotels before. The rooms were very comfortable - my only quibble being, I would have liked a kettle in the room. The location is excellent and everything is within walking distance. The concierge also recommended Ae Sconte restaurant for us on the Saturday night and that was superb. Can't wait to return again!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In By Miles - Stunning”
Reviews.Author: howe2855
Reviews.Content: I can't describe how beautiful the hotel is and the room we stayed in. The hotel has lovingly been restored with all the modern amenities you would expect whilst still respecting the history of the hotel. Absolutely stunning. The pictures on thr Ruzzini Palace Hotel's website arte accurate Our trip was in our 10th anniversary year and was meant to coincide with the 11th anniversary of when I asked my wife to marry me in Venice. However....... Unfortunately, we were meant to travel from the UK to Venice in January this year but due to snow we had to cancel and we had to cancel the room at the Ruzzini as well. The staff who dealt with the cancellation were very helpful and understanding and also promised a very good deal if we rebooked with them. Which they came through on when I rebooked for March. Which I don't think I would of got if I didn't book directly with the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel (we had no trouble finding it, walking) we were met by friendly, enthusiastic and helpful staff. We were told (and we couldn't quite believe it) we were upgraded to the best room in the hotel, the Royal Suite ("if you don't like it we've got no better" he joked). Myself and my wife were absolutely gobsmacked by the room we were shown to. It was huge by comparison to most hotel rooms let alone rooms in Venice. Beautiful decor with an original stucco ceiling and art work on the walls. Massive bed, the temperature of the room was perfect, everything was just perfect! The view was out on to the picturesque square in front of the hotel. The room was very quiet and very relaxing. They also provided a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine upon our arrival. Although, the hotel did not have a restaurant they provided us with some great suggestions for places to eat and we had lovely meals and great service. I would recommend that you try their recommendations. Breakfasts had everything you could want fruit and yogurt, to continental, to Eggs and Bacon. It's great to know the hotel is brilliant when things go right and when they go wrong (no fault of the hotel see above flights in Jan), there was also a general strike in Italy on the day of our departure. The staff kept us up to date with any problems, helped us with alternative travel arrangements. In the end the strike didn't really affect us too badly, but it was great to know that the hotel was so helpful. Our flight wasn't until 5 in the evening with check out at 12. The hotel stored our bags for us, so we could spend a few more hours touring this beautiful city. I cannot recommend the Ruzzini highly enough and we will be definitely returning. I have already made at least 5 personal recommendations to people who are thinking of going to Venice for this hotel. Including one to a poor lady on the plane on the way home who had to listen to me sign the praises of the Ruzzini most of the way. Thank you to all of the staff at the Ruzzini Palace Hotel for making our trip so very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Room was cozy!”
Reviews.Author: JJChet
Reviews.Content: Room was cozy and breakfast was good. Hotel near the water bus station as well as marco polo plaza, very convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: WorcestershireBeau
Reviews.Content: The Ruzzini Palace Hotel is SUPERB! The best hotel we have ever stayed in and highly recommended. It is situated on a relative quiet square but only minutes walk from all the main tourist hot-spots and close to many fantastic restaurants. The Hotel have been restored to an exceptionally high standard and our room was beautiful with every luxury. The breakfast is very good with plenty of choice. The staff were brilliant and nothing was too much trouble. They were courteous and extremely attentive to our needs and requirements. They were always willing to help us plan routes, supplying maps and information. We used the airport transfer arranged by the Hotel. The water taxi brought us under the Rialto Bridge to the Hotel - what a spectaculat start to the holiday! Venice is a very special place and this Hotel is absolute gem, completing a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE place to stay in Venice, at the moment. Quite superb!”
Reviews.Author: suchfussytravellers
Reviews.Content: The Ruzzini Palace hotel is for the really discerning traveller who does not want to come away for a few nights on a special trip and feel disappointed by the standard of accommodation. That just will not happen in this hotel. From the minute you walk through the door, it shouts style and sophistication, but you pay a relatively cheap price by Venice standards. Don't expect a bargain, but you will feel you have had real value for money. Our junior suite was upgraded to a palatial suite overlooking a quiet canal with a 30 foot balcony. It was extremely quiet, which is rare in any city centre hotel and was so central that all of Venice's many sights were a stroll away. The bathroom was modern with a fabulous bath, and the bed was super king size. The staff were courteous and unobtrusive, but full of knowledge if you needed directions etc. This hotel has not been open long, so my advice is to visit now before the countless recommendations on this site make it impossible to get a room.

Reviews.Title: “The very best in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: OssamaMontreal
Reviews.Content: The very best in Venice. Very elegant recently renovated historic Venetian palace that used to be the home of a patrician family and a Doge! It's ideal for a romantic stay in Venice. The staff is extremely helpful. The concierge, Michele, went out of his way to get me very hard to get opera tickets. When in Venice, this is my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and helpful throughout”
Reviews.Author: bere0044
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel and would go back again in a heartbeat. We were in the Suite Paradiso. The room was over the top. First the sitting room had an extra high ceiling, floor to ceiling windows that led to the balcony overlooking the canal below, a flat screen TV with international DVD player, enormous chandelier, two sitting chairs, a couch, and a table with four chairs. The bedroom had a much lower ceiling (but it was still beautiful with the wood beams), another flat screen TV, and the bathroom had a nice sized marble bathtub/shower. The location of this hotel was great. It's just a short walk to San Marco or the Rialto Bridge. The staff is amazing and extremely helpful in every way possible. The staff had assisted us in booking a water taxi to the train station (our luggage was too heavy to trek up and over all the canals again). They knew we had planned to travel from Venice to Florence and then to Rome, so to our surprise upon checking out we were handed maps for both of our upcoming destinations as well as restaurant recommendations. He even marked our hotels on the maps! I should also mention that we did go to one of his restaurant recommendations in Florence and it was the best meal I had on this trip (Buca Mario)!

Reviews.Title: “Eat, pray, love tour of Europe”
Reviews.Author: DMARTINEP
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Ruzzini Palace in February, 2010 with my daughter who is an experienced European traveler. Having never been to Venice, I wasn't sure what to expect but the Ruzzini Palace answered those questions. The location was perfect for a short stroll to the Rialto Bridge and there are plenty of restaurants a stones throw from the hotel's front door to spur your interest. We are in a suite which is beyond all expectations, large, airy and reminiscent of the period. The staff is over the top in helping us, the breakfast is adequate, beds are plenty comfortable. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: H4girls2boys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ruzzini Palace with our two daughters (aged 5 & 7). We can not say enough good things about this hotel and the staff. I booked this hotel after reading several hotel reviews on tripadvisor. All of the great reviews were 100% accurate. The Chef Concierge, Michele Vianello, was wonderful. As were the other concierges we spoke with. Unfortunately, we forgot to get the other names. The lady that served us breakfast in the morning was so friendly and helpful. She anticipated us coming and had the coffee we liked ready. The breakfast was great and the coffee was awesome. The rooms were very spacious (we were all four in one room). The staff was very accommodating and added two extra beds to our room for the kids. We still had plenty of room. The view from our balcony of the square was beautiful. We left our car at San Marco parking garage and took a private water taxi (70 Euros) to the hotel lobby. I highly suggest doing this! It is well worth the 70euros! It is 70eruos total for everyone in your group, you can always split the cost if you have other adults along. Michele helped us in the morning planning our day. The hotel gave all of us a free trip to Murano and a private tour of the glass factory there. I asked Michele before we took the trip if there would be pressure to buy anything. We were not going to buy a big glass piece, maybe something small for the kids. He told me that was no problem. The glass factory gives the free tour so you can see the difference between their good glass and the glass from China sold all over the Island. The free tour was wonderful. They picked us up in a private water taxi, took us on a our tour the Grand Canal, and then to Murano. The glass tour was so fun. They gave both of my girls a free glass horse they had made for demonstration. We never felt any pressure to buy anything. They were very, very nice. Definitely do the tour!!!! The beds were nice, the tv was a big flat screen, honestly, everything was perfect!!! The price for this hotel was really good. We compared several hotels. This hotel was way nicer than some of the more expensive hotels. We are living in Switzerland and hope to come back every year for the next few years. There is always something new to see and discover in Venice. We will always stay at our favorite Venetian hotel. It's beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: debjay50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of the Carnivale and unlike other hotels the room rate did not change for stays during and after the festival - we got a great rate through travel republic and could not have been happier with our choice. The size of the room was excellent compared to other hotels we have stayed in on the island and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotels website provided directions which made arrival painless and the buffet breakfast a great way to start the day. The location is only a few minutes walk from all major attractions but in a less touristy area with lots of great places to eat and drink at reasonable prices close by. We will definitely use the hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cjwBristol
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, set in a peaceful square just 300 metres from St Marks Square and Rialto bridge, if you don't get lost findng them. The easiet way to the hotel is by water taxi but this is very expensive. we arrived via the orange line Alilaguna and got off at Rialto bridge. The hotel web site has directions from here which were very clear and took us straight there within 10 minutes. Initially we were given a room on the top floor . The room was very nice , clean and large enough but as it was in he roof it had no view at all. you had to climb on a chir to see out . we spent one night in this room and discovered that despite it being february and 0 degrees outside, our room was an oven. the air con/ heating was turned off at our request but despite keeping the windows open it was still over 25 degrees c at night.needless to say this was not comfortable. we discussed the problem with the front desk and they tried to rectify it with the central control system but when this did not change the temperature they could not have been more helpful and offered us another standard room. this was on a lower floor and was definatley cooler. when we actually came to move rooms we were shown to a diferent room which turned out to be a junior suite, did we want to move to this one? of course we did, it was devine. The staff could not have been more helpful throughout our stay both rooms were spotless and the porter very knowledgeable as well as all on the front desk. A day after our heat issues we overheard another couple complianing to the front desk about the heat and they too had loft rooms so if you do stay here and are offered a loft room be warned that for some reason they are very hot. Breakfast was a little limited in range if you want something even just a little healthy, very indulgent on pastry and croissants but all fresh and tasty. there is no reasturant here for eveing meals but there are many eateries around to suit varied budgets. There is internet access in the lobby but not free. â‚¬3 for 20 mins or â‚¬6 for 3 hours. you can check in online and print boarding cards through this service. They provid daily american german and french newspapers but no british papers and ther english speaking tv channels are BBC world news , which is awful,and CNBC. Eurosprot is in German you don't come to Venice to watch english TV Overall a lovely hotel in a fabulous location but if you are offered a loft room be prepared to like it hot.

Reviews.Title: “TOP CLASS HOTEL - HIGHLY RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: adventures10
Reviews.Content: Stayed (28th-31st jan 2010) in the Ruzzini palace hotel. It is definitely a 4star hotel. All the staff are very friendly with good English and very helpful. The breakfast was lovely, with plenty of choice(fruit, yogurts,breads,rolls, pastries,scrambled egg,bacon,hams, chesses,juices,tea,coffee,jams, nutella, Philadelphia and even presscco to start of the day! It is in a lovely location nice and quite and short distance to walk to rialto and st mark square. most importantly our room was lovely, nice size, lovely bathroom, hall way off room where we could hang our clothes and keep our bags and also where the safe was. Would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. i spent weeks researching hotels before finally choosing the Ruzzini and i was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Modern with a classic twist - perfect for romance!”
Reviews.Author: MrBond42
Reviews.Content: Really nice location (water taxi brings you right to the canal entrance at the back of the hotel. Beautiful square greets you as you walk out. Nice and central - 10 minutes walk to St Marks Square - 10 minutes walk to the public transport boats. Inside the hotel is just beautiful. Classic and ambient with a lovely modern twist. Bathrooms are gorgeous, Concierge incredibly helpful in pointing you in the right direction. If you're looking for romance then this is the perfect hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “a rare gem of a hotel in a city of many mediocre ones”
Reviews.Author: aWeeTrampAbroad
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, historical building that has been redone as a design hotel. There are no spa or pool facilities, but since when do you go to Venice for that! The location is wonderful - about a 10 minute leisurely walk from St. Mark's and Rialto, but slightly off the beaten path so that you get some quiet and are away from the typical throngs of crowds. Breakfast is simple but adequate - Italy is not known for its breakfasts, so save your appetite for an exquisite lunch or dinner elsewhere. The room was beautiful - old (I assume preserved) woodwork mixed with modern touches, and a completely modern and very clean bathroom. Our room even had a walk-in closet/private changing area - a delightful touch, especially for the ladies with luggage :-)! And if you have some extra time, do explore the hotel! There's a really beautiful sitting room on the 2nd or 3rd floor with gorgeous ceilings and a grand piano. The staff is very professional and somewhat old-school (in a very good way). They aren't there to chat you up and make small talk, but always ready to help and answer questions and make suggestions. All staff - concierge, hotel, restaurant, room - are very courteous and polite, friendly but discreet, and very professional but warm. It wasn't the most expensive, but also not the lowest in price. A fair deal for Venice! (Of course, we were there in December during the holiday period, which is the lowest of the low season) Based on prior reviews, we decided to take the plunge and conscientiously payed more for this hotel. And from the first step into the hotel up to now, we have absolutely no regrets in having done so.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Canguy65
Reviews.Content: Ragazzi!!! Thank you very much for everything you did to make our stay in Venice unforgettable!!!! (Porcho cun!). We look forward to visiting this summer and hope you all have a wonderful season of health and prosperity. Tantissimi bracioni! Massimo e Jennifer

Reviews.Title: “Venice is magical, and this hotel was the icing on the cake"”
Reviews.Author: emmaanddan1
Reviews.Content: We booked the Ruzinni Palace after much time spent on TA on the basis of location, price and reviews, and it lived up to expectations on all three counts. We stayed here for four nights to celebrate our anniversary, and from the moment we arrived we felt at home. A piece of advice - if arriving from the airport, book a private water taxi - luxurious, but worth every penny, as the hotel is quite far from any vaporetto stops and will be a fair old trek with luggage, but the RP has a rear access directly on to a canal, so you will be from your flight to your room in 30mins. The place was beautifully decorated throughout, with a well balanced mix of modern and classical styles and decoration, without the overbearing and oppressive feel that seems to be the case when looking at traveller photos of other venice hotels - this was understated luxury. The room was by far the largest we have ever stayed in and was more a suite than a room, located at first floor over the breakfast room, overlooking the square. Again, the room was beautifully decorated, with a bathroom pod in the centre and enough space around about it to get lost in. There was complimentary prosecco ready-chilled in the room, along with a massive bouquet of flowers (which i had organised with the concierge prior to our stay) waiting as a surprise for my partner - the price of which was excellent value for the size and quality of the flowers - an example of just one of the touches that made this stay so special. Nothing could have been too difficult for the staff to arrange - they were always on hand and attentive, spoke perfect English and ensured that we wanted for nothing. They even managed to arrange a mobile hairdresser to come to our room for my partner on the night of our anniversary (we had a booking for dinner at Cipriani's - worth it for the meal, but stay at the Ruzinni) on a Monday night when every hairdresser in Venice is closed - this sort of attention to detail that makes this place stand out. Breakfast was better than most Italian hotel continental breakfast offerings, with bottles of prosecco waiting to be emptied, always a good start to the day. Although the hotel only has breakfast facilities, this is no problem, as there is a wealth of excellent restaurants in the vicinity - we tried Osteria Alle Testiere, again on the basis of the TA rating (#6 in Venice) and the fact that it is 1 min walk away from the hotel (restaurant is delightful but very small, so book in advance) - food was magnificent. Campo Santa Maria Formosa, the square which the hotel overlooks is picturesque and lively without being a tourist haven and is lively enough without becoming a noise nuisance - try to get a room with a view of the square, as we get the feeling that they are probably lighter (south facing) than other rooms. As for location, it couldn't be better - you are five minutes walk from all the major sights (as long as you don't get lost, but that is part of the fun and romance of the place), but it is not in the thick of san marco and the hustle and bustle of the cruise ship day trippers. Our advice is spend a day doing San Marco, then lose yourself into Castello or San Polo to get a true feel of Venice, and a day trip to Burano is a must. The hotel even arranges complimentary water taxi to see a glass blowing factory in Murano - bit of a con, but if you know in advance, it works in your benefit, just get the water taxi, do the tour, then if you don't buy, ask to get let out of the back entrance and make your way to Murano waterfront and have a wander, and get the vaporetto to other parts of the lagoon. Again, TA ratings didn't let us down - RP was #12 at the time of booking, and we're not in the least suprised that it finds itself #5 on the Top 25 Hotels in Italy chosen by Europeans in the TA Traveller's Choice Awards - our city break to Venice was magical, and this hotel was every bit as perfect as La Serenissima herself - stay here if you can

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in central locale”
Reviews.Author: Sara3010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ruzzini Palace for six nights over New Year and were delighted with our choice based on Tripadvisor reviews. We were very fortunate to be upgraded to a junior suite overlooking Campo Santa Maria Formosa, and Michele and Mario on reception could not have been more helpful. The hotel is well located (central but quiet) and represents excellent value for money in an otherwise expensive city. We wouldn't hesitate recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Has everything that you would expect from a four star hotel, and more”
Reviews.Author: hazeldenedublin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Ruzzini Palace in mid January. We used the hotel airport transfer facility and although we arrived in early our room was ready for us.The site of the hotel is excellent as it is in a relatively quiet part of Venice but is close to St Marks and all the main sites of interest. The hotel is a tastefully restored palace which captures the Venice of another era while at the same time providing all amenities associated with a four star boutique hotel. The staff are exceptional in their attention to the needs of their guests. The Breakfast area is very pleasant and an excellent choice of food was provided. I would highly recommend a stay this hotel to enhance your visit to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place!”
Reviews.Author: solgal
Reviews.Content: Went to Ruzzini Palace Hotel after reading the reviews - also had bought couple of guides to Venice but decided to go with Trip Advisor recommendations instead - definitely worked! We were delighted with the Ruzzini. We booked direct with the hotel as the offer, although slightly more expensive, seemed better deal. Turned out the best bet: we had our room upgraded to a deluxe room from classic - it was a great room too - huge bed, generous sized room, double sink in the marble bathroom and separate wardrobe area. All for Â£100 per night! We even had room service free, so had breakfast each morning in the room: bliss! Didn't need a lunch after all that arrived either! Will be going back that's for sure! The other thing that we loved so much was how friendly and helpful the staff on the front desk were. Made such a difference to our stay. In fact, although I have mentioned it as the end, it was one of the most important features.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Tillywoosgrren
Reviews.Content: An unbelievable place to stay - a must for anyone wanting to sample the flavour of times gone by, yet wanting to be at the hub of the excitement of Venice today.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this wonderful palazzo”
Reviews.Author: bettybird
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, well restored and in a perfect location. Campo Santa Maria Formosa is in the centre of Venice, so everywhere is genuinely easily walkable with 3 vaporetto stops within a 10 minute or so brisk stroll. It is also sufficiently away from the tourist scrum of San Marco and the Rialto to appreciate the tranquility that Venice's car free environment promotes. Our room was very pleasant, with 2 small balconies overlooking the rio. However the design failed to make best use of the available space and was dominated by the "pod" bathroom in the centre of the room which made it feel smaller than it actually was. Service was good Very good buffet breakfast with plenty of choice. It is a shame that it is served in the rather cramped confines of the converted store rooms on the ground floor, when the gloriously decorated principle reception room on the Piano Nobile seems to be sadly underused. How delightful it would be to start your day with breakfast in such sumptuous surroundings! All in all a very enjoyable stay. It is also worth noting that room rates in Venice are very variable depending on demand. So if you are travelling off season you may find that this hotel, which would be way over your budget in June or September, is just about affordable in December or January!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning luxury and fab location”
Reviews.Author: Eamocoll
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, great location between Rialto and San Marco overlooking lovely piazza quiet bar and restaurant though

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: steveoCoventry
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights for my wife's 40th birthday at the start of November 09. The hotel overlooks a delightful square, with a small canal at the back, our deluxe room was perfect, lovely en-suite, lots of space and a very big and comfortable bed. Breakfast was plentiful, with lots of choice, and the staff were very friendly. Only 5 mins walk from St Mark's with some lovely restaurants within a few minutes walk. I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wow and thrice wow! Utterly fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: TheBarls
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the most amazing hotel we have ever been lucky enough to stay in. The hotel itself, the service from all staff and the breakfast was all second to none. This hotel will make your stay in Venice that bit more special and trust me, Venice doesnâ€™t need any help in being fantastic. I would urge anyone considering the Ruzzini Palace Hotel to stop considering and start booking. We will definitely be returning to this stunning hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mutated_ideals
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ruzzini Palace in September 2009 for the first few nights of our Honeymoon in one of the junior suites. The hotel is situated within walking distance of either San Marco or Rialto on a quiet square. We found this to be a good location becaues it was quiet, but not too far from the things we wanted to see in Venice. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel provided us with a map of Venice, which proved extremely useful. Our room was lovely: very spacious, clean and well decorated. The bed was large and comfortable. A nice combination of traditional Venitian and modern styles. The breakfast was a small buffet with a small selection of cooked options to compliment the cooked meats, fruit, barkery products and cereals on offer. Not quite the selection you'd expect in a similar starred British hotel, but definitely better than the other hotels we stayed at in Italy. We did not use the bar during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilW84
Reviews.Content: Would reccomend this Hotel to anyone who is visiting Venice. Its less than a ten minute walk from San Marco Square but far enough away to allow a quiet stay. There are variou restaurants close by one of which was reccomended by the consierge at the Hotel. Only a 5 minute walk from the Boat Station from the airport. Staff were very helpful and arrange both a night at the Opera and a Gondala ride for us. Also close to shops and all the sites Venice has to offer. I based my selection of the Hotel on the other reviews and I was not dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “I never write reviews but this was such a nice hotel...!!”
Reviews.Author: llovelondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ruzzini Palace in July with my teenage son. Room was lovely (and we were upgraded), very clever conversion with lovely view over the Campo. We got a complimentary bellini in the bar - small touch but nice - and the barman made my son a glamorous non-alcoholic cocktail!.Breakfast room small but functional and breakfast was good, excellent fresh coffee. Location very central, easy to walk to most places. Staff great -all of them - but especially at reception where everyone was completely bilingual and really helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Really Cool Hotel and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: ABGSC
Reviews.Content: The Ruzzini Palace was full of history and a little mystique. They did a wonderful job preserving the 15th century structure and it's history while outfitting it with modern conveniences. The staff was truly fantastic, even finding an open pharmacy for us late at night. We also enjoyed evening cocktails and chatting with the bartenders in the hotel's bar. The location is fantastic - close to the Rialto and St. Mark's, but out of the typical touristy hustle and bustle. My only advice is to skip the boat ride to Murano, or at least expect extremely rude people when you go (very hard sell).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thermalbus
Reviews.Content: Great location, luxury hotel, great rooms, fantastic staff. Cost a little more than the normal but for a special occasion worth every penny. 5 minutes walk to St Marks Square, Rialto Bridge but tucked away in its own very pleasant square. Good breakfast, complimentary champagne for our aniversary and the most helpful and welcoming staff who could not do enough for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous....”
Reviews.Author: toolbox99
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Rooms clean, service wonderful.. I cannot praise this hotel any more. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steffili
Reviews.Content: During our honeymoon, we stayed for one night in Ruzzini Palace Hotel in Venice. Although we booked a double room, we got a free upgrate for the Royal Suite. We were very impressed by this lovely hotel, a great Suite, very good breakfast and very nice hotel service. Thanks a lot for the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: ADayNotWasted
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days at the end of our trip around northern Italy. This hotel was the best stay during our entire trip. We were very lucky to receive a complimentary upgrade to a suite facing the piazza. The room was among the best we have stayed in anywhere in the world and the service from the front desk to the breakfast and cleaning staff was excellent. Finding the hotel is a bit tricky but everything thing is hard to find in Venice. You can walk to the hotel from the Rialto bridge if you have a manageable number if bags. The location is pleasant as it is away from the tourist crush and is surrounded by some very nice places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, EXCELLENT service”
Reviews.Author: jdandlsd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ruzzini Palace the night before we began a Mediterranean cruise, in order to get a real taste of Venice. We chose Ruzzini Palace based on Trip Advisor reviews, and they were right. This hotel has larger rooms than we expected, including a beautiful modern bathroom with amenities. Our accommodations were immaculately clean, and modern while still keeping the old world feel of the building. The location was perfect, within easy walking distance of virtually everything but off the beaten path enough to get a break from the crowds. The very best thing about Ruzzini Palace was the service. The chief concierge, Michele Vianello, catered to our every need. I contacted Michele long before our arrival to ask for help planning transportation from the airport to the hotel, and from the hotel to the pier. Michele arranged all of this for us, and our connections were flawless. He also made an excellent recommendation for a restaurant for our night in Venice and made the reservation for us. Anything we needed was provided without question. My husband and I had an excellent stay at Ruzzini Palace and definitely plan to return when we can stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “The Ruzzini Palace is an elegant oasis in an often crowded city.”
Reviews.Author: deberry10
Reviews.Content: Our junior suite, with patio overlooking the Campo Santa Maria Formosa, was spacious and beautifully appointed, with a separate sitting room where we relaxed at the end of the day. Oversize chairs and contemporary styling, mixed perfectly with Venetian frescoes and art in this intimate, yet friendly hotel. The front desk staff and chief concierge, Michele Vianello, know how to pamper their guests! We were met at the train station and escorted by private water taxi to the canal entrance of the hotel, giving us an introduction to the Grand Canal on the way. The Ruzzini Palace is perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Recommend you stay there”
Reviews.Author: DogeRuzzini
Reviews.Content: The Ruzzini Palace Hotel was a wonderful experience. The room (suite) was exceptional, the staff were attentive and helpful at all times, the location was central and all tourist sites were very close. The breakfast was excellent however the hotel did not have a restaurant for dinner but many restaurants were close at hand.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of good reviews”
Reviews.Author: WarsawScatts
Reviews.Content: This was the third hotel on our driving tour of Austria and Italy and was also chosen based on earlier reviews in here. Before the hotel - Venice in August is to be avoided if possible. Hot like hell, sticky and, as usual, full of tourists. The myth about it being smelly is not true, there are stinky parts but no more than any other city but the heat makes slogging around Venice all day and standing in overcrowded vaporetto long pretty hard work. If you can go in April or October then that's what we'd do next time. Allow at least â‚¬35 per person for dinner each night (including kids), even if you only have pizza and spaghetti. That doesn't include wine. Even if you think the menu adds up to â‚¬50, they will find a way to add charges for bread, coperto, table-cloth, salt & pepper, breathing space..... and you'll end up with double what you expected. If you're on a budget you're going to be eating from streetside windows flogging slices of pizza and tins of coke. Allow another â‚¬loads for entry tickets to everything you want to see and also for all those drinks you're going to need every hour if you're there in August. In brief, the city is expensive and can be done adequately in 3 days so don't stay there too long! This hotel is a converted palace and the work has been done very sympathetically. The combination of history with modern hotel facilities works very well. Our room was massive, in terms of both m2 and m3 with a ceiling height of perhaps 6m. I would say it had a definite air of luxury about it but was perhaps missing something when it came to comfort or homeliness. It was a little impersonal, like you were staying in an art gallery and not someone's home. The service was excellent from the front desk. Breakfast was okay, not great. Poor eggs, cheap juice, small room, slowish service. Not representative of the hotel generally. However, breakfast in Italy seems not to be a priority anywhere we stayed. Location of the hotel is fine and you can get to both San Marco and Rialto in about 10-15 min walk, although we liked the area around the Peggy Guggenhiem better so might go over there next time. Getting to the hotel is fun. We drove and parked in the garage San Marco (â‚¬30 per day). From there you have a choice of a â‚¬70 water taxi all the way to the hotel's canal-side entrance or a vaporetto ride to Rialto and then a 15 min walk with heavy bags over about 8 small bridges with steps. We chose the latter as I couldn't get my head around a â‚¬70 taxi ride. It was hard work in that heat! There's no question this hotel is impressive and gives an appears to be very good value - a room in a palace for â‚¬200 per night (what we paid anyway). I'm not convinced about the comfort factor though, nor about the location, so whether we would stay there again is debatable.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: LouisePaloAltoCa_
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ruzzini Palace Hotel for 5 nights and thought everything about it was great. The room was large - the cleanliness was great. The concierge helped us with places to see and eat and ways to do things. He was knowledgeable and polite and truly interested that out stay be perfect. I liked its location. A 5 minutes walk from San Marco or Rialto and yet quieter than either of those places. The square where it is located is large and it has a beautiful old church and simple street cafe's. We'd stay there again if we were going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: starfish21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ruzzini Palace for two nights with our family of 5 and wished we had stayed longer. They upgraded us to two junior suites connected by a private hallway and the rooms were clean an luxurious. The best part about the hotel is the Chief Concierge Michele. He arranged a private boat tour of the Grand Canale and then trips to Murano and Burano ( not to be missed). Then we had lunch on Torchello at the Locando Cipriani, whic was the best meal in our 12 day tour of Italy. We also had a fabulous dinner recommended by Michele at a small family run Osteria. The location of this hotel can't be better as it is away from the hussle of St, Mark's but close enough to walk easily. All in all I am dreaming of going back. We left something in our room and Michele even contacted us at our next hotel and arranged to have it sent..HE is the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic quality and service in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: scotara
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quality in all areas. The finish in the rooms and all areas was very high and we were very impressed and could find no fault the longer we stayed. The hotel looked very recently refurbished and was not at all tacky, touristy or tacky. The roomwas spotless and cleaned every day. As we booked direct with the hotel they gave us the upgraded room which they said they would!! The hotel was only a short walk from the Rialto bridge and vaporetto stop and was in a very quiet square so it felt relaxing in the madness of Venice.Breakfeast was excellent a huge choice of fruit, cooked, meats and cheeses etc, even champagne! I would definately stay here agin and would strongly recommend it if you are off to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “small is beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: soroushkoochooloo
Reviews.Content: They have created a beautiful, spacious, modern and comfortable interior in and old exterior! Service and staff are superb. For its price, it was the best in our 21 day trip all over Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Venice Romance at the Ruzzinni”
Reviews.Author: JeneeRenee
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in this beautiful hotel on our honeymoon. We booked online with no problem. They think of every detail - wine in the room when we arrived, not to mention that the room itself was truly stunning with original stucco on the ceiling! Wow. We had a great view of the square - fun to watch all of the locals setting up shop in the morning. Great central location, but not too close to Saint Mark's square. The breakfast was delicious, with pretty much anything you could want. The concierge staff were very helpful, giving us directions and helping us find restaurants, art exhibitions, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Friedel_9
Reviews.Content: We have been with three couples in Venice after a one-week-cruise. We had booked the Ruzzini Palace via internet and when we arrived, our expectations were exeeded. Friendly reception, nicely decorated large rooms, great breakfast and a quiet but centally located place - just a few minutes walk to St. Marco Place. When we return to Venice the only place we will go is Ruzzini Palce Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous honeymoon hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: princesskatycat
Reviews.Content: Arrived by watertaxi to this gorgeous hotel. Suitably grand honeymoon destination. Complimentary prosecco delivered to the room. A luxury hotel with thoughtful extras. Bubbly is available at no extra charge with breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: MindeS
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Ruzzini in the end of April with my spouse. it was our first (but not the last time) at Venice. The hotel was in a great location, few hundred meters from hustle. The room was lovely and so was the breakfast. Staff were friendly and very polite. We felt ourselves like royals.:)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Portugal_Couple
Reviews.Content: The minute we arrived to the Hotel by water taxi we got surprised with the amability of the reception personnel. They were/are extremelly kind! We got early to the Hotel (10am), and our room was not ready, so they invited us for a coffee in the breakfast room, with no charge! We went for a walk in Venince, and when we got to the Hotel after lunch, to put our bags in our room, we were surprised by the fact that they were already in the room, and that they had made us a free upgrade to a Royal Suite!!! Fantastic Suite! A very big living room, with sofas, LCD, DVD, champagne, a very nice room (also with LCD) and a very very good bathroom, all with a really interesting furniture combining old and new styles. The suite has a balcony in the living room, with a very nice view over a small canal where you can see the gondolas passing by! The breakfast is in a very well design area, and it is excellent, with great juices, even champagne, fresh french croissants, etc... and a great great service by a very nice Portuguese waiter. We were told that the Hotel is not a 5 star due to the fact that does not have a restaurant, and we believe it. Every service, every space in the Hotel is excellente! And why do we need a restaurant? Venice is fantastic to walk by, and we just asked the reception personnel where to eat, and the restaurant recommendations were fantastic! The Hotel is near to the main attractions in Venice, 5min walk to St Marks Square and to Rialto Bridge. Very very good location. Although it is near this places the Campo St Maria Formosa is a very quiet square, with not so many people like in the small streets around St Marks or Rialto. In conclusion, the best City Hotel that we've stayed in. Totally recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, elegant hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: DEBORAHYork
Reviews.Content: All our expectations were surpassed by this fabulous hotel and the helpful professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: fabsoLondon
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. The staff has been great. Our luggage did not arrive and they took care of everything and kept us informed of what was going on. Took a lot of the stress out! Also it was our wedding anniversary and they kindly brought us a bottle of prossecco on the second day. Made the stay very pleasant. Room nice (deluxe) but a bit on the dark side.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: NÃ¼rnbergSusanne
Reviews.Content: This is an old palazzo that has been restored with lots of care and taste. The rooms are beautiful and have been furnished with top quality furniture. We got a free upgrade to the most beautiful room I have ever stayed in. I loved how the interior was a perfect balance between modern and old. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful in arranging restaurant reservations and giving advice and tips for touring the city. Breakfast is very good with a nice selection. The location is perfect, there is a small square in front with nice cafes and a canal right in back so you can get a private water taxi right in front of the hotel. All the sights a just under a 5 min. walk. Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Great! One of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: justin345
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and very helpful. The rooms are well-appointed and a lot larger than expected. (They gave us a free upgrade). Everything is located within a short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Just absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Anne06London
Reviews.Content: We can't recommend this hotel highly enough! We arrived by private water taxi and from the moment we walked into the hotel we were impressed. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to the most beautiful suite with fantastic ornate painted ceilings and furniture, and lovely views over the square. The hotel staff are all corteous and polite and extremely helpful. The breakfast was beautifully presented and there was plenty of choice. The hotel is situated just far enough away from the main tourist areas to be quiet and relaxed, but it was only a short walk to St Mark's Square. This was without doubt, the most beautiful hotel we have ever stayed in, and we would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We felt like Royalty at the Ruzzini Palace”
Reviews.Author: sassystar
Reviews.Content: We came in and it was pouring rain. My husband navigated us through the canals and side alleys to Ruzzini Palace. We were THRILLED!! We had our own personal conceirge who attended to our every need!! We arrived before official check in and they allowed us to check in early. Our room was elegant and spacious. We had a huge bathtub and a balcony! We had a walk in closet and another balcony where we enjoyed wine and cheese while watching the gondolas pass below. When we come back we will definately be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Dropped Laptop in Canal”
Reviews.Author: artanon
Reviews.Content: They dropped my laptop into the canal, and never offered me a single euro. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wieles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ruzzini for three nights. We were upgraded to a junior suite: a beautiful and comfortable room with a great view on the nice square in front of the hotel. Location is very good. Quiet and San Marco Place an Rialto Bridge are in a short walking distance. Staff is friendly and helpfull. Breakfast is not abundant but quite sufficient. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Ruzzini Palace is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PotteringUk
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, friendly staff and first class service. Perfectly placed for a Venice holiday and if you get them to arrange your water taxi they'll take you right up to the back door, so no walking across the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: always_the_adventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ruzzini Palace for 3 nights and found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The room was lovely with a nice view and the location of the hotel was great. Only 5mins walk from St.Marks and the Rialto but just far enough from all the touristy areas so nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Great Reception Guy called Simone!”
Reviews.Author: AlphaB
Reviews.Content: The location is great as you are minutes away from Rialto and also St Mark's Square. Quiet area just minutes away from the crowds. The actual hotel is beatiful. We got a deluxe room overlooking the canal and it was very spacious and very comfortable. We had a gorgeous bath however the shower wasnt great as it sprayed everywhere so you end up having more water on the floor than inside the tub. There was also a separate room where they had two chairs and a sofa and you could relax there. what lets this hotel down is the breakfast, not a breakfast you would expect from a 4 star hotel in Italy. The selection was poor and if you came down at 10.00 they were not restocking which was annoying. Simone (the reception guy) made us very welcome and he was always very helpful and attentive. Every hotel should be full of Simones. He is a great asset! Thanks very much for your help and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Junior Suite was HUGE”
Reviews.Author: AKTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last July and absolutely loved the location, staff, and room. There was a comedy of errors leading to our arrival; We exited the Vaperetto on the wrong side of the Grand Canal with some pretty heavy luggage on a hot summer day in Venice with the streets packed. We are young and active, and this extra time exhausted us. I felt like we were on "The Amazing Race". Do yourself a favor and pay whatever it cost's to get delivered right to the canal behind the hotel. Once at the hotel the location is prime! The staff is attentive, and the coffee at breakfast is awesome. Just be careful to take it easy on the Italian coffee. I drank a pot because it was so good and got so wound up, I could barely talk and my heart was palpitating. I got a tour of a few rooms and they are all very nice, but the Jr. Suite is the way to go if you like spaciousness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, awesome service, really special building”
Reviews.Author: makapuf
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with my girlfriend at the Ruzzini Palace for a nice and romantic weekend in Venice. I had booked a junior suite (room 301) about two months in advance and we were very happy with the room. The hotel is ideally located 5 mn from Rialto, and 5 mn from San Marco, but far enough from all the hassle of both places. It is located at one end of a large and beautiful square, Campo Santa Formosa, and if you are lucky enough to stay in one of the rooms overlooking at the square, the view is incredible. I have been in Venice twice and walked everywhere and I think it's one of the most georgous squares in the city. It is less touristic than San Marco, so there are a couple of excellent restaurants around, a supermarket.. The hotel itself: Excellent service, the clerks spoke italian, english, french, and were able to help us out and even recommend us with nice restaurants and even booked a reservation for us. The room was quite large but I think a bit smaller than international standards (it's quite common in Venice). The room was a mix with old fashion paintings and newly renovated walls, very high ceilings, Excellent huge beds, and we were offered a bottle of Prosecco. I highly recommend booking a room with the view on the square. On the other side, there is a small canal and I think another building across so I'm sure the difference of view is big. There is internet available for free in the lobby. The only disappointment was the breakfast: I think it's a bit cheap for a hotel that nice and expensive. It's just a standard breakfast with hot beverages, low quality juices, cereal, croissants, bacon and eggs, etc. It's basic, sufficient but I would have enjoyed more choice and better quality. I would highly recommend this hotel for its location, service, and the charm of the building itself which is an old palace renovated into a hotel. It made our stay very special!!
